- **[Maximum And Minimum Inventory Levels.](#Maximum-And-Minimum-Inventory-Levels.---)**
- [**Compatibility with Existing Software.**](#Compatibility-with-Existing-Software)
- [**Inventory Trend Analysis.**](#Inventory-Trend-Analysis)
- **[Reasonable Price.](#Reasonable-Price)**

#### 1\. User-Friendly

User-friendly inventory management software should have the following features:

- Easy to navigate
- Load information quickly
- Be simplistic
- It’s not overloaded with features you don’t need

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/h11YU18Vu8k?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

The system should also include new user training. If you’ve never used inventory management software, getting started can be intimidating. So exploring something as complex as an ERP is out of the question. Explore the training features before you purchase the software. Do they offer videos and directions for new users? Can you reach out to a live person for help?

Of course, the term “user-friendly” is different for each organization. The only way to know for sure whether you like software or not is to try it out. The good news is many programs offer a free trial so you can experiment for the right fit.

#### 2\. Will Grow With Your Business

When you first sign up for inventory software, you might just be looking for something to streamline your inventory. But as you are done achieving that you may realize that your business needs optimizing further. Will you be able to upgrade the software? If not, you and your staff will have to relearn a whole new system in the future.

For example, you may need a system to optimize your production process since your sales have increased or you may want to add new users to the system.

A platform like [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software&utm_campaign=6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software) provides just that. The basic version which is free provides an integrated system for any SME to optimize its operations. The advanced version further provides production planning modules to users.

#### 3\. Maximum And Minimum Inventory Levels

<blog-image alt="Maximum and Minimum Stock Levels | Inventory Software |  TranZact" image="stock-maximo-almacen-operativa.jpg"></blog-image>

Stock Levels

Accurate inventory levels prevent under-stocking by ensuring that staff has the right signals to reorder inventory. Also, it prevents overstocking and the chances of inventory getting damaged or wasted. When inventory reaches the minimum level there are reminders given to reorder stock. Similarly, it doesn't let Businesses dealing with stock have tracked their inventory accurately, to keep ahead of the competition. Stock control helps to keep a constant flow of satisfied customers. It also improves the working environment and flow of businesses. It results in more sustained growth continually.

Read More - [The Importance of Accurate Inventory Levels](/blogs/the-importance-of-accurate-inventory-levels?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software&utm_campaign=6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software)

#### 4\. **Compatibility with Existing Software**

Most businesses use multiple types of software at once. Ideally, your inventory management software will be able to integrate with your existing business software. This allows your two software systems to share information, sync, and generally “play well” together. Compatibility is necessary because it’s a huge time-saver – why spend time transferring data between systems when you can avoid it altogether? Thus providing integration with software like [Tally](https://tallysolutions.com/) Excel or Google sheets can be a huge lifesaver.

Read More - [Is Just An Inventory Management Solution Enough For SMEs?](/blogs/is-just-an-inventory-management-solution-enough-for-smes/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software&utm_campaign=6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software)

#### 5\. **Inventory Trend Analysis**

One of the biggest features of inventory management software for small businesses is the ability to tell you how much you have left of each product. However, some systems can also help you predict future inventory needs. Data analysis uses information from your inventory cycle to help you make better business decisions. For example, it can track your historic sales to predict when you will get a surge of purchases, so you can buy extra inventory and prepare better for your peak season.

#### 6\. Reasonable Price

The amount you spend depends on how many features you need. You should never invest in software with unnecessary modules which you feel you might need in the future. With the future being highly uncertain because of COVID you should invest in an easy-to-use and [economical software](/pricing?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software&utm_campaign=6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software) which you can upgrade if you need more features.

#### Way Forward

Very often, as a simple medium, small business owners use spreadsheets to record and calculate inventory data. But the bottom line is that these spreadsheets are not specialized in dealing with the inventory tracking process.

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tenUbEqzJt4?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

On the other hand, an inventory management system is solely dedicated to keeping the record and forecasting trends that are necessary to make informed business decisions. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software&utm_campaign=6+%27Must+Haves%27+Features+For+Your+Inventory+Software) helps SMEs manage inventory through their integrated business operations platform. . It is the best choice for SMEs because of its seamless integration with Tally, Google Sheets, and dozens of other solutions. Also, it provides an enormous library of training and support resources 24\*7.

Effective inventory management is about having the right product/raw material in the right place, at the right time. Now that you’ve seen all the inventory management mistakes you are probably making, it’s time to take action.

Make a wise choice!

_data.text:
Spreadsheets are everywhere… They are probably the most frequently used tool in the majority of firms and business processes.Most small manufacturing businesses start off with using registers to track inventory. Then as the data increases, they start spreadsheets for sales order tracking, manufacturing planning, and inventory management.

And it works fine but only at a micro scale.

As your business grows, you will quickly run into all sorts of trouble if you continue managing your inventory with spreadsheets.

Read More - [Inventory Management: Ultimate Guide for SMEs](/blogs/inventory-management-ultimate-guide-for-smes/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=6%20Reasons%20Why%20Excel%20Doesn%E2%80%99t%20Work%20For%20Inventory%20Management)

<blog-image alt="Inventory Management" image="1603969903-shutterstock374648065.jpg"></blog-image>

Spreadsheets are not scalable. You will soon lose sight of your inventory levels on-hand, amounts expected from suppliers, slow-moving inventory, and so on.

And this will end up costing you a lot of money.

- missed delivery deadlines mean unhappy customers;
- cash is tied up in excess inventory; and
- material purchasing is out of sync with manufacturing.

Thus maybe it's time to move to the next level.

Read More - [Ways To Improve Cashflow In SMEs During Pandemic](/blogs/ways-to-improve-cashflow-in-smes-during-pandemic/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=6%20Reasons%20Why%20Excel%20Doesn%E2%80%99t%20Work%20For%20Inventory%20Management)

Here are 7 reasons why you shouldn't use spreadsheets of inventory management-

#### 1\. Error-Prone and Time-Consuming

The thing with Excel is that the employees would enter the data there manually. That’s the reason why mistakes most certainly will be made. We think you have also been there. Data entry errors can result in making mistakes in business decisions.

When you enter information by hand, this is going to lead to a lot of errors. This particular approach is also rather time-consuming. This is what makes it inefficient.

#### 2\. Less Scalable

This is also something that you should consider.

As soon as you start to track hundreds or even thousands of items through Excel, you will quickly realize that it can be overwhelming. Even the 'Excel expert' in your company can only deal with a limited number of sheets and tabs at the same time.

Also, the whole reason why you want to track inventory is that you want to find it on demand. But you won't as you'll be maintaining a large number of sheets as it is.

#### 3\. No Real-Time Information

A spreadsheet is simply not capable of tracking real-time stock flows.

Your current stock levels are only going to be as real-time as your most recent data entry. This is why you wouldn’t be able to track and know where your stock currently is.

Stock tracking is something crucial for your overall stockroom, and if you can’t rely on the software to handle it, you'll have to do it manually which will be error prone and time-consuming.

#### 4\. Data all over the place

Drawing insights from data is an important part in any business.

Spreadsheets will crunch and provide numbers for you. But what about analysis and reporting? Excel can never show you the big picture. It’s just numeric data scattered all across, despite categorizing them in sheets. Because there is no centralization, you can’t analyze your entire stock and its flow, from all of the portals, together.

This is why you might want to consider your options once again.

#### 5\. No Analysing or Forecasting

Excel hardly prepares you for the future and rarely ever takes past data into consideration. This makes it a bad option for analysis.

Excel graphs and trendlines are very basic and ineffective with growing market complexities. The [forecasting formula](https://www.excel-easy.com/examples/forecast.html) in excel uses 2 variables only, whereas, in real life, there are many additional factors that are supposed to be considered which Excel, of course, doesn’t. That is why it doesn't work for inventory management

#### 6\. No Automation

Excel is the antonym of automation!

It’s all about manual data entries, except for very basic conditional formatting.

Inventory spreadsheets do not update automatically when you purchase materials, manufacture your products, or sell them to your clients.

Spreadsheets require continuous manual updating, which is time-consuming and stressful. This means that your inventory spreadsheets are generally out of date.

So maybe it's time for you to move to another solution for inventory management.

Read More - [5 Ways Inventory Management Software Increases Sales & Profit](/blogs/5-ways-inventory-management-software-increases-sales-profit/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=6%20Reasons%20Why%20Excel%20Doesn%E2%80%99t%20Work%20For%20Inventory%20Management)

#### Way Forward

As you can see, there are many **drawbacks of using Excel** when it comes to stock management. You need to consider all of them.

Worry not. There’s a large and established market that provides ready-made inventory management software solutions. They are tailored for businesses of different sizes and industries. It's important for you to choose one that is affordable and easy to use.

[TranZact](http://letstranzact.com?utm_source=blog&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=excel_sucks), for example, is geared towards SMEs to streamline their business processes. These are typically small manufacturing companies who have traditionally relied upon paper records or spreadsheets to manage their stock and now want to go digital solution.

Get rid of cumbersome Excel sheets and check out how [TranZact helps SMEs manage inventory for free.](http://letstranzact.com?utm_source=blog&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=excel_sucks)

_data.text:
Inventory management is the process of tracking your inventory from purchase to the sale of goods or stocks. It involves such activities as restocking, ordering, inventory forecasting, and storing. Whether you’re from the e-commerce, manufacturing, or logistics industry, having an efficient inventory management system is essential for your company. 

You may ask: what are the functions of the inventory management system? Some of the functions of inventory management software include improving a company’s productivity and efficiency, preventing stock-outs and over-stock, easy inventory management, and improving profitability. Having an inventory management system in place will enhance your cash flow, help you save money, and most importantly, leverage your customer satisfaction rate. 

Wondering how to prepare and effectively introduce an inventory management system for your business? Read on to find out. 

## 1\. Evaluate Your Needs and Requirements

Before investing in inventory management software, you need to ask yourself: what do you want to monitor in your inventory management process? Do you need to keep track of inventory levels?

You also need to determine the possible solutions you want to get out of your inventory management system, such as:

- Centralized tracking
- Stock auditing
- Paperless documentation
- Optimal service level
- Automatic reorder points
- Inventory classifications
- Dashboard collaboration
- [Business intelligence dashboard](/blogs/business-intelligence-dashboard-an-ultimate-guide-for-smes/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+Tips+on+Introducing+Inventory+Management+System+to+Your+Business%3A+How+to+Prepare+for+It+and+What+to+Consider&utm_campaign=6+Tips+on+Introducing+Inventory+Management+System+to+Your+Business%3A+How+to+Prepare+for+It+and+What+to+Consider)
- Productivity tools
- Transparent software performance

Knowing your needs and requirements firsthand will help you get the most suitable software for your inventory management processes. 

## 2\. Consider Customization Features

If you have complex inventory processes and specifications, you need to get an inventory management system with customization features. For example, if you want to get rid of unneeded stock while ensuring you never run out of product, the vendor should know about these concerns. Your provider should also know whether you prefer software that offers insights regarding customer behavior or one with an inventory forecasting function. 

Further, for companies that already have an inventory management system and just want to have additional features, make sure the new software can be easily merged with your existing one. 

## 3\. Think About System Integrations 

Integrations are important in any software. So, for small businesses, the integration of tools may not be a big concern. But if you’re eyeing to grow your business in the future, you should consider it. Even startups have utilized up to four different inventory management systems to simplify their company operations. 

So, a typical example of integrations with other systems is an inventory management tool being integrated with accounting, purchasing, warehouse management, e-commerce, and [tally systems.](/blogs/tally-integration-why-do-indian-smes-businesses-need-it/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+Tips+on+Introducing+Inventory+Management+System+to+Your+Business%3A+How+to+Prepare+for+It+and+What+to+Consider&utm_campaign=6+Tips+on+Introducing+Inventory+Management+System+to+Your+Business%3A+How+to+Prepare+for+It+and+What+to+Consider) 

## 4\. Consider Flexibility and Usability of Inventory Management Tools

Another important factor you need to consider before introducing an inventory management system to your business is flexibility and usability. Further, as per [Meili Robots’ statistics](https://www.meilirobots.com/resources-list/e-commerce-statistics), there’s a growing demand for flexible and reliable automated systems to improve retail companies’ productivity and operations.  

So, before purchasing a new inventory management system, ask yourself: is the software compatible with all types of devices? Is it an on-site or web-based system? You also need to know how many users it can accommodate and if it would be flexible with your different store locations. 

As for usability, you need to learn the ins and outs of the inventory management tool. Remember that your goal is to find a system that will simplify your business processes, so a tool with complicated features isn’t truly worth purchasing. 

## 5\. Examine the Cost of the Software

If your budget permits it, you can always buy the best and most expensive inventory management software in the market. But if you want to save money, you may opt for the cheaper ones with good quality. However, the price examination doesn’t end there.

The cost of inventory management systems mostly depends on the complexity or simplicity of your needs and requirements. So, when you enumerate your needs, and the vendor gives you a price, you need to evaluate if it’s just right or too expensive. 

These days, finding worthy software isn’t that difficult anymore. Thanks to the availability of affordable and efficient cloud-based solutions fit for startups, small businesses, or companies with low budgets. According to a [survey by Meili Robots](https://www.meilirobots.com/resources-list/e-commerce-statistics), automation and cloud-based software are getting more popular in the material handling equipment industry. 

## 6\. Learn the Best Inventory Management Practices and Techniques

Last but not least is that you should learn the best inventory management techniques. By doing so, you can effectively implement the inventory management tool in your business and make the most out of it. 

Some of the best inventory management practices include:

- [Economic and minimum order quantities](/blogs/economic-order-quantity-how-eoq-is-useful-for-sme-businesses/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+6+Tips+on+Introducing+Inventory+Management+System+to+Your+Business%3A+How+to+Prepare+for+It+and+What+to+Consider&utm_campaign=6+Tips+on+Introducing+Inventory+Management+System+to+Your+Business%3A+How+to+Prepare+for+It+and+What+to+Consider)
- ABC analysis 
- Safety stock inventory
- Just-in-time inventory management
- First-in, first-out method
- Last-in, first-out method
- Batch tracking
- Dropshipping

Aside from learning the best practices, training employees would also be crucial when introducing an inventory management system to the company. Hence, the need for employees with relevant educational backgrounds and experience, such as the [best online supply chain management bachelor's degree](https://research.com/degrees/online-bachelors-degrees-in-supply-chain-management), would be beneficial. 

## Introduce an Outstanding Inventory Management System to Your Business

Implementing inventory management systems to your business processes can be challenging, especially if inventory management is something that’s overlooked in your company. Hopefully, the tips above will help you prepare for your next software purchase and introduce the best inventory management tool to your company.

_data.text:
In today's busy and fast-moving world, every SME owner and business manager in big corporations needs to have all their business data at their fingertips. And the simple reason behind these insights they can easily take several key business decisions without wasting any time. Because for the businesses, time-saving is like an **[Opportunity cost concept](https://www.stlouisfed.org/open-vault/2020/january/real-life-examples-opportunity-cost)**, which results in money-saving. So the automated reporting notion is of great use for these companies. So, they tend to rely on **[Business Intelligence](https://bit.ly/3CdCINc)** and **[Reporting dashboards](/use-cases/category/business-dashboard?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.&utm_campaign=Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.)** for getting quick and summarised updates of their all daily business activities.

SMEs, manufacturing concerns, and other businesses using the Reporting dashboard can know about critical areas where they are struggling. Further, with the detailed reports, they can identify the problems and find the solutions accordingly. Additionally, they can configure the automated reporting system to provide specific **[KPIs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8asfI8RQ5_8) reports**. Also, use a reminder function that will send daily business updates about that particular area of interest.

So the purpose of you all coming to this blog is to learn more about the Automated Reporting concept for your businesses. Then let's start with that!😃 😊 😍

## What is Automated Reporting?

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/84Du-ib40Uo?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

**Reporting Dashboard in TranZact**

Automated Reporting or Reporting Automation is a concept of providing the users (or business management) with relevant business insights without putting any extra effort. It is also the process for creating, updating at fixed time intervals, and transferring the business reports through different methods.

<blog-image alt="Automated Reporting example" image="image.png"></blog-image>

These reports will get instant updates as per any new change happening in the organization. Also, the users of these reports can configure the system. So, it will inform them about these changes through any triggered event or task.

## Advantages of an Automated Reporting System

After understanding the concept of the Report Automation or Reporting Dashboards, the SMEs may be wondering if they need it or not? So to answer this question, Yes, they need it. The reason is simple they want to grow themselves and make their core business activities smooth and effortless. So for that to happen, they happen to automate themselves first. And using a report automation tool can help them with it.

Before going deep in choosing software, we should make clear the benefits of using this type of tool.

#### 1\. Improving the Organization Effectiveness.

Through the automated reporting system, all the information will be available and accessible to all departments in the organization. With the help of it, anyone can quickly generate their custom reports as per their needs. And this removes the dependency problem. Because no user has to wait for some other department to provide the specific data they need for preparing these reports.

#### 2\. Improving the Reporting System.

With the help of an automated reporting system, the users can easily convert their reports as per their needs. They can add various filters and columns which they require for different purposes.

#### 3\. Securitisation of Reports.

By using the Approvals and Permissions function in their software, SMEs can restrict access to critical business data. Further, they can easily get the business updates daily to selected persons in the organization.

#### 4\. Time-Saving.

With the use of report automation, the time of users can get saved, which was getting lost on the preparation of these reports. Further, SMEs can quickly make essential decisions on the basis of these reports.

#### 5\. Human-Error Reduction.

With the use of software solutions, the chance of any manual error gets reduced. Additionally, it provides a much more clear view with real-time updates.

## Way Forwad

 So from all the above discussions, it may have become clear to you all the benefits of the Automated Reporting process and software for your business.

Also, before implementing the report automation software, in your organization, you must list all your requirements. And accordingly, as per your business's nature and these needs, select a report automation solution. So, [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.&utm_campaign=Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.) is one such solution that takes care of the reporting needs for SMEs and manufacturing concerns.

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.&utm_campaign=Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.) is a digital transformation tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. Its daily business digest feature provides daily business insights through mail to the users about their organization.

Read More about - [Business Intelligence Dashboard – An Ultimate Guide for SMEs.](https://bit.ly/3CdCINc)

Further, the Reporting and Business Intelligence dashboards provide much more detailed updates of their businesses. And businesses should choose [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.&utm_campaign=Automated+Reporting+-+Ultimate+Guide+For+SME+Businesses.) or any other software if they satisfy all their needs.

_data.text:
Currently, all the businesses worldwide are facing many tough challenges due to this ongoing Covid-19 pandemic. And it has become impossible to handle all the business operations by being physically present at the place of business. This situation has created a lot of chaos in many organizations that were working manually. So these businesses are looking up ways to digitalize themselves, and their one-stop option has become ERP software.

## What do we mean by ERP Software?

The word ERP stands for Enterprise Resource Planning. It is a business management software that helps in managing daily business operations like accounting, raw material procurement, project management, payroll management, supply chain management. Also, ERP helps in tracking the resources like cash and inventories. Apart from that ERPs, helps in integrating all the data generated from different business activities and providing the information flow in a compiled and simple manner to the top management and its stakeholders.

The concept of ERPs has many times been misunderstood by small and medium enterprises (SMEs). Due to this confusion, the SMEs have wrongly implemented the ERP system that was not required then. This poor decision has cost them losses both in terms of time and money. So it is always advised to SMEs to plan out all things before investing in ERP software.

Read More - [ERP for SMEs? Think again](/blogs/erp-for-smes-think-again/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021)

## Difference Between ERP Software & Accounting Software

<blog-image alt="Difference between ERP Software and Accounting Software." image="ERP-Accounting-difference-1024x409.jpg"></blog-image>

Many people are still confused between ERPs and Accounting software and consider it to be the same thing. But in reality, the ERPs and Accounting software are different from each other. 

Accounting software helps in maintaining Accounts Receivables, Accounts Payable, Financial Reporting, Bank Management related information. And ERP Softwares manages Inventory Management, Customer Relationship Management, Supply Chain Management, and many other activities in addition to accounting-related data for the businesses. So the Businesses should keep in mind their needs while choosing between the Accounting and ERP software.

Read More - [ERP Implementation Failure- How Company Size Matters](/blogs/erp-implementation-failure-how-company-size-matters?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021)

## List of Best ERP Softwares for Different Need

1. [Tally ERP.](#Tally-ERP)
2. [Oracle.](#Oracle--)
3. [SAP.](#SAP--)
4. [TranZact.](#TranZact--)

#### Tally ERP

[Tally ERP](https://tallysolutions.com/) is one of the oldest and renowned ERP software present in the Indian Market.

<blog-image alt="Tally ERP software." image="tally-prime-1.png"></blog-image>

###### Features-

- It is one of the best software which caters to all the Accounting and GST related needs of small scale retail businesses.
- Tally ERP is of great help to those organizations that have a small volume of transactions.
- Tally ERP software provides the real-time basis data and all type of Financial Reports for around one year.

###### Limitations-

- Tally ERP does not serve as an ERP software but rather as Accounting software, as it fails to function as an integrated business management software.
- This software is very complex to understand, and only well-trained users can operate the Tally software efficiently. Due to this reason, every time one trained person needs to run the ERP system.
- The maintenance cost of Tally ERP software is much higher when compared with other options present in the market for the same purpose and scale.

Read More - [Is Tally enough for your SME](/blogs/is-tally-enough-for-your-sme?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021)

#### Oracle

[Oracle ERP](https://www.oracle.com/in/erp/) software is known as the best cloud-based software that helps in automating all the essential business processes like project planning, product life-cycle, reporting, compliance, governance, and risk management.

<blog-image alt="Oracle ERP Software" image="Oracle_ERP_Cloud_1.jpg"></blog-image>

###### Features-

- It offers the best cloud-based software with the lowest upfront cost in the range of Tier 1 ERP softwares.
- Oracle ERPs provides many types of [ERP Modules](https://www.esds.co.in/blogs/basic-modules-of-erp-system/#sthash.u1471Gna.dpbs) like Financials, Project Management, Risk Management and Compliance, Enterprise Performance Management (EPM), Supply Chain & Manufacturing, ERP Analytics, which caters for the needs of different types of businesses.
- The cloud-based technology of this software enhances the speed of business processes, and also the integrated flow of information helps in taking fast and data-driven decisions.
- The Customer Support System of the Oracle softwares is 24\*7 and provides the best services whenever needed by its users.

###### Limitations -

- Oracle ERP software is only beneficial for large scale enterprises that work in different verticals or are working in multiple locations.
- The Operating and License costs of the software are not reasonable for SMEs even though it has the lowest upfront cost in the Tier 1 ERP softwares.
- The Different [ERP Modules](https://www.esds.co.in/blogs/basic-modules-of-erp-system/#sthash.u1471Gna.dpbs) are of no use for small businesses, as they might create confusion when operating the software.

#### SAP

[SAP ERP](https://www.sap.com/india/products/enterprise-management-erp.html) is the global market leader of ERP Softwares with over 40 plus years of experience in this field. It is the industry-recognized software that offers both cloud-based and on-premise software is the best option available for large corporations.

<blog-image alt="SAP " image="1200px-SAP_2011_logo.svg_-1024x522.png"></blog-image>

###### Features-

- SAP offers very comprehensive softwares for its clients to cater for their needs. They can choose from its variety of tools which to use as per their organization requirements.
- It provides Cloud Security management to its clients for their data and is very efficient for security.
- The software provides an integrated flow of business information, and with the use of this information and Business Intelligence tools help their users to make better decisions.
- The Customer Support System of the SAP ERPs is 24\*7 and provides the best services whenever needed by its users.

###### Limitations-

- SAP ERP software is very costly softwares and has both High upfront and maintenance costs.
- The software is generally suitable for big companies which have large volume transactions and can hire Trained users who can operate it as it's very complex for inexperienced users to understand.
- Also, SAP involves a lot of time to get implemented in the organization due to its complex nature.
- The main reason behind using SAP is its integration between ERP modules.  Sometimes its users do not understand if the ERP modules are required or not, and this situation often creates chaos in the organization.

#### TranZact

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p2zkQKD76o8?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

[TranZact](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Best%20ERP%20Software%20to%20use%20in%202021) is a zero-effort digital transformation tool that digitizes the entire business process right from sales inquiry to dispatch. It is very different from Traditional ERPs but provides all the benefits of ERP software like accounting, inventory management, and other things like faster documentation, streamlining all core business processes. Therefore it is easy to use and implement in the organization compared to ERPs like SAP & Oracle.

<blog-image alt="TranZact " image="4117676-1024x199.png"></blog-image>

###### Features-

- It is a cloud-based digital transformation tool and is easily accessible and very easy to use. So it is very well suited for Small and Medium-scale Enterprises (SMEs).
- It offers the software Free of cost to all users for an unlimited time as they believe in their [Freemium policy](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Best%20ERP%20Software%20to%20use%20in%202021). [TranZact](/blogs/6-must-haves-features-for-your-inventory-software/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021) team always encourage its customers to use the free tool first. And suggests the customers upgrade when there is a need for any additional services.
- [TranZact](/blogs/6-must-haves-features-for-your-inventory-software/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021) BI dashboards help its customers to understand how their business is performing currently. And it also helps them to take quick and data-driven decisions.
- [TranZact](/blogs/6-must-haves-features-for-your-inventory-software/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021) uses AWS cloud services to run its software which provides complete data security for its customers.
- The main feature of this software is it's easy to use no formal training is required to operate it. And the features like Tally Integration and Inventory Management helps out in saving time by avoiding double entry in accounting software and also helps in tracking and managing the business flow.

###### Limitations-

- [TranZact](/blogs/6-must-haves-features-for-your-inventory-software/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog+-+Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021&utm_campaign=Best+ERP+Software+to+use+in+2021) is very much suitable for SMEs, but for the large corporations which are working in many verticals, it is not advisable right now. It is continuously evolving and will in future be useful for large enterprises also.

## Conclusion

In today's time, Businesses and their top management should properly examine their organizational structure and its requirements by keeping in view of their stakeholders while choosing an ERP software for themselves. A wrong decision taken by them could lead to a huge setback for the organization and could lead them to many years backward in their journey. So they should keep in mind their size, structure, type of business, budget constraints, and many other factors and take things very seriously while deciding about the technology they would choose to automate and digitalize their organizations.

_data.text:
In this age of severe competition where everyone is fighting for their survival and is meeting a race with its competitors to succeed in their industry, there's one organization promoting the new startup companies providing the best products and services to their customers. And this organization is an online publication known as Best Startup Asia. 

Best Startup Asia helps to promote Asian businesses and provide them an international stage. This publication reward organization that are taking steps into innovations that can have a positive impact on society.

And we feel proud to say that [BestStartup.Asia](https://beststartup.asia/) is rewarding [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) by featuring us in its [Best Startup Asia Magazine](https://beststartup.asia/) in its last month’s article **101 Top Indian Enterprise Software Companies and Startups of 2021.**

<blog-image alt="Best Startup Asia features TranZact in 2021's Top 101 Indian Startups List." image="Indian.png"></blog-image>

## Brief Overview of TranZact

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) is a zero-effort Digital Transformation Tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. And in this period of emergency caused by the Coronavirus global pandemic, when all businesses, whether large or small scale, were having difficulties in managing their business activities due to lockdown and all offices were closed, [TranZact's](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) team was present there to rescue its customers. 

[TranZact's](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) cloud-based system allowed its consumers to work from their homes and monitor all their business operations and activities. With [TranZact's](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) efficient inventory management system, the business owners were able to maintain their inventory levels and manage their procurement processes.

Furthermore, with its intelligent BI Dashboards, the SME owners were able to monitor the status of receipts and payments, production processes, and many other things without being personally present in the factories and analyzing every document. Also, the documentation process was all streamlined, so both the customers and suppliers didn't have any problem with it.

Best Startup Asia chose [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) because of our exceptional performance in their metrics for evaluating the companies. And to give you all an idea about those metrics, we have written it here -

- **Innovation**
    - Innovative ideas
    - Innovation in route to market
    - Innovative product
- **Growth**
    - Exceptional growth
    - Exceptional growth strategy
- **Management**
- **Societal impact**

## How TranZact is Innovating the Indian SME space?

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Best+Startup+Asia+features+TranZact+in+2021%27s+Top+101+Indian+Startups+List.) has begun the initiative of providing the best and easiest to operate automation software to the Indian SMEs. _data.text:
In the times of this dangerous pandemic when the whole world was facing a complete lockdown situation, the essential businesses were still operating amid the pandemic to provide for the requirements of their consumers. But at that point in time still, these manufacturing concerns were not running in full capacities. Because of which it was becoming difficult for the business managers and owners to operate it efficiently. Also, they were lacking in making a decision due to the lack of required data and information. The businesses that were operating manually or digitalized both had the information with them. But the manual organizations lacked people or resources who easily interpret this information. And on the basis of these interpretations, these businesses tend to make decisions. On the other digitized companies were using the **Business Intelligence Dashboard (**or **BI Dashboard)** for this whole thing.

And the management can make decisions with the use of this graphical representation of data with BI reports.

## What is Business Intelligence Dashboard?

A Business Intelligence Dashboard, or some people call it Business Dashboard, is a tool that helps businesses in their reporting needs. BI Dashboards is a reporting and analysis tool that provides different **[Data Visualizations](https://venngage.com/blogs/data-visualization/)** for simplifying data like the status of [**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)**](https://www.klipfolio.com/resources/articles/what-is-a-key-performance-indicator) and other relevant information.

[<blog-image alt="TranZact's Business Intelligence Dashboard. (BI Dashboard)" image="transaction-module.png"></blog-image>](/use-cases/category/business-dashboard)

**[TranZact's BI Dashboard](/use-cases/category/business-dashboard)**

And this graphical representation of business data helps users and policymakers in companies to take appropriate steps for improving the position of business in the market.

## Features of Business Intelligence Dashboard

The BI dashboards help to analyze data from key datasets, to improve business decisions. So that's why the dashboards should get purpose-built and designed as per the organization's needs.

The modern BI dashboards provide the users with both historical and real-time data analysis. Further, the users can customize these dashboards. In addition to that, the dashboards are interactive, and users can get detailed information with dashboards in the form of BI Reports.

## Benefits of BI Dashboarding

The Business Intelligence Dashboards are making the companies able to provide the complex data available to all of their users. Additionally, making it easier and understandable for users belonging to different backgrounds of work.

So let's understand what all more benefits BI Dashboards provide -

1. These dashboards help the management of a company in performing activities like **[Strategy Planning](https://onstrategyhq.com/resources/strategic-planning-process-basics/)** and **effective Decision-making.**
2. The BI Dashboards helps in recognizing the Business Trends. Accordingly, provides the analysis that if the particular trend can become an Opportunity or a Threat for the company.
3. With the help of BI Dashboard, the sharing of information can get easily done between different departments. And this process also increases the participation of the various departments in the decision-making process. Further, making it more efficient.
4. The modern BI Dashboards pull out both historical and real-time data for the reporting and analysis part. And the users can customize these dashboards as per their needs for different goals.

## Way Forward

With the help of this blog, you may have learned about the importance of the Business Intelligence Dashboard. So as to implement this tool in your organization, you all have to use business automation or business intelligence tool in your organization.

Therefore businesses can choose any software solution available in the market which offers the BI Dashboards module for themselves.

But they should keep in mind whether the software solution is satisfying all their needs or not and is perfect for their nature of business. So for the small and medium enterprises and manufacturing concerns, **[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs)** is one of the best software solutions that offer BI Dashboards solutions.

Read More about - [ERP for SMEs? Think again](/blogs/erp-for-smes-think-again/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs)

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) is a zero-effort digital transformation tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. Additionally, its Business Intelligence Dashboard feature provides insights into your top customers, products, or where did the business flourish more. And on this information basis, you can make better data-driven decisions.

The [TranZact team](/our-team?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) provides their digitizing tool on a [Freemium policy](/why-free-forever?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs). Because we want our customers to take a step forward in digitizing their businesses [without having to think over silly amounts of money](/pricing?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs). Further, the organizations must choose [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Business+Intelligence+Dashboard+-+An+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) or any other software only when it meets all their requirements.

_data.text:
We have talked to a lot of manufacturing businesses about their problems and goals. But there is one more problem that every SME faces. Many SME owners face the difficulty with growing their business but lack present resources or putting more precisely without any capital infusion.

In this guide, we show you **how you can grow your manufacturing business** without adding more capital. Yes, you can learn **how to expand a small business** without or with minimum borrowing.

Continue reading to explore 5 smart tips on **how to grow a small business** without spending money.

#### 1\. Monitor and Track your Cash Flow

If you are able to track the amount of money coming in and out in your business you are amongst a very few of small manufacturing businesses

Managing cash flow is not always a simple feat. It's important to regularly track the movement of funds in and out of your organization to determine the financial status of your business and what it will be in several months.

Without healthy cash flow, it's impossible to grow your business, hire new workers and properly manage your finances. 

Here are a few **business growth tips** to get clients to pay on time:

- Offer discounts to clients who pay up-front.
- Keep track of pending payments and pursue them responsibly.
- Tighten your [payment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Payment) policy when onboarding a new client.

Read More - [Ways To Improve Cashflow In SMEs During Pandemic](/blogs/ways-to-improve-cashflow-in-smes-during-pandemic/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Can't%20Keep%20Up%3F%20Ways%20To%20Grow%20Business%20Without%20Spending%20Money)

Using digital platforms like [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Can%E2%80%99t%20Keep%20Up%3F%20Ways%20To%20Grow%20Business%20Without%20Spending%20Money) makes it easy to track your payables, receivables, and other expenses on a day-to-day basis. Having your inflows and outflows at your fingertips is crucial to make your business grow.

It gives you a clear picture of how to budget and better use the available finances in hand.

Read More - [Digital India: Why Businesses should Go Digital?](/blogs/digital-india-why-businesses-should-go-digital/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Can't%20Keep%20Up%3F%20Ways%20To%20Grow%20Business%20Without%20Spending%20Money)

#### 2\. Try To Maximize Profits

In business, it's difficult to find new ways to generate profit. It can only happen if you start a new product line. This will need capital.

So instead you might as well focus on how you can maximize profits in your present business.

Keep a track of all the products your business is manufacturing. This can be done by analyzing which product is most in-demand and gives the most profit. These products are called cash cows.

Try to identify the highest-profit-making products in your portfolio. Try to focus your efforts on expanding sales of these products via additional marketing.

This helps in boosting your profits, which you can then redirect to expanding your business.

Read More - [Tackling Top 4 Sales Challenges In Indian SMEs](/blogs/tackling-top-4-sales-challenges-in-indian-smes/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Can't%20Keep%20Up%3F%20Ways%20To%20Grow%20Business%20Without%20Spending%20Money)

#### 3\. Use Your Customers' Network

If you’re wondering **how to expand a small business**, the answer is right in front of you. Yes, we’re talking about leveraging your existing clients to help you spread the word about your brand. It’s an easy and effective strategy to scale up. Here are a few ways to implement this strategy:

- **Ask you are Happy Customers to Post a Review**
- **Provide your Customers with a [Referral Code](https://www.business2community.com/online-marketing/what-is-a-referral-code-and-how-does-it-work-02061099) to Spread the Word**

#### 4\. Establish Brand Authority

You need to focus on building [brand authority](https://moz.com/blogs/build-brand-authority-with-content-marketing). Authoritative brands are those that customers trust. These brands are the go-to source of information for any topic in their niche/industry. Spending time establishing your authority in your domain is crucial to business expansion. Only when customers trust your brand they are likely to spread the word about your brand in their circle. This helps in establishing the longevity of the brand.

- Be willing to share helpful information to customers via different channels like blog posts, FAQs, social media posts, tutorial videos, etc.
- Avoid delivering a sales pitch while sharing knowledge. This reduces the legibility of your brand. To avoid this, keep the sales pitches and knowledge sharing separate – preferably in different posts.

#### Way Forward

Growing a small business takes time, effort, and resources. Just because you can't invest more money on capital, it doesn't mean you have to put your business expansion dreams on hold. Explore the tips listed above and brainstorm creative ways on **how to grow your business**.

Remember that for any business to grow, you need to focus on streamlining daily operations like bookkeeping, inventory management, etc. Though these tasks may seem minor, they are essential to keep your business running like a well-oiled piece of machinery. Productivity in these areas makes a ton of difference to your business line. Apps like [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Can%E2%80%99t%20Keep%20Up%3F%20Ways%20To%20Grow%20Business%20Without%20Spending%20Money) can help you streamline operations, inventory management, and other administrative tasks, freeing up your time to focus on core business practices and expansion.

Read More - [5 Ways Digitization Can Optimize Your Company’s Profitability](/blogs/digitization-to-increase-profitability/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Can't%20Keep%20Up%3F%20Ways%20To%20Grow%20Business%20Without%20Spending%20Money)

_data.description: Indian government has been trying to promote cashless economy since 2016. How beneficial cashless economy would be for India?
_data.title: Cashless Economy: How Is It Important For India?

toc.text: Past efforts of Indian Government for making a Cashless Economy.
Why should India be a Cashless Economy?
Measures taken by the Indian Government?

children.value: Cashless economy is the term that everyone uses to describe the situation where the flow of cash does not exist within the economy. All the transactions take place through electronic channels. Going
eases one's life. It also helps formalize the transactions. Further, it helps to curb corruption. And also, the flow of black money that results in an increase in
Now, in the situation of this global coronavirus pandemic. The people of all statures got to know about the benefits of cash-less economic transactions.

Many of us from the events of Lockdowns and till now are afraid to use the currency notes. And we tend to sanitize them as soon as we reach our homes. Because we all fear that this currency may carry the virus, and that's why we don't want to use it.

Additionally, in the event of complete lockdown, many of us were unable to withdraw money from banks and ATMs. Due to this problem, we started using UPI and other digital payment options to purchase goods. And further, we understood the importance of these payment methods.
The same thing is happening with everyone around the world. So we all, with corporate and business houses, are shifting towards cashless transactions.

So to help you all understand the efforts Government is taking to make India a Cashless Economy, we have prepared this article. And we think that with this blog, you can assess what our state is doing for us and how we can contribute and improve it. Let's begin with it.
Past efforts of Indian Government for making a Cashless Economy.
Why should India be a Cashless Economy?
Measures taken by the Indian Government?
Past efforts of Indian Government for making a Cashless Economy.
The Finance Minister announced in the

will get charged on cash withdrawals exceeding Rs.1 crore in a year from the bank account. The motive behind this particular announcement of our government was to discourage businesses' cash payments transactions.

Additionally, to promote digital transactions among corporate houses. The government announced that companies with an annual turnover of over Rs.50 crore to offer low-cost digital payment modes. Moreover, the state is giving them the benefit of no additional or Merchant Discount Rate charges on them and their customers.
It is an excellent move by the Indian Government to incentivize people to adapt to the emerging cashless economy.

Nearly 90% of all transactions in the Indian economy were dependent on cash before the pandemic. It's because of the large informal sector that employs 90% of the labor. India cannot become cashless unless this sector adapts to digital payments.
Incentivizing the people alone is not sufficient. The government needs to develop the supporting infrastructures and technologies for India to become a cashless economy.
Why should India be a Cashless Economy?
India should shift to a cashless economy. The reasons for this statement are as follows:

A lot of time and money goes into printing cash. RBI has spent Rs.32.1 billion on printing the currency. Also, there is the cost for the setting up of and maintaining of the ATMs. Furthermore, the paper currencies have shelf-life after which it needs to get replaced.
Cash is the driver of the shadow economy

: Cash is difficult to trace. Illegal activities like tax evasion, black money, etc can also be carried out with cash. In 2007, currency in circulation was almost on par with the bank deposits. However, in the last three years, the currency with Indians was more than the bank deposits by 50%. The amount of black money (unaccounted money) in India is 15-16 lakh crores. It may get used to finance illegal activities like terrorist activities, purchasing votes, smuggling, betting, trafficking, etc.
Enables financial inclusion and increased tax revenues

: A cashless economy makes it necessary for all citizens to have bank accounts. This will ensure a higher financial inclusion rate. It will also guarantee transparency in the transaction of money within the economy – minimizing the possibility of tax evasion exponentially.
Measures taken by the Indian Government?

props.alt: Indian Government steps for building a Cashless Economy
Measures taken up by Government of Indian for building a Cashless Economy

children.value: Demonetisation drive has not curbed the black money. However, it had pushed India towards being a cashless economy. It has become a radical
to transform India into a cashless economy. Paytm witnessed
daily usage post demonetization as opposed to their average transaction of
within the first two days of post-demonetization. Further,
One of the biggest financial inclusion initiatives in the world was launched in 2014.
. It has an integrated approach to bring comprehensive financial inclusion and provide banking services to all households within the country.

This scheme ensures access to a range of financial services like availability of basic savings, bank accounts, access to need-based credit, insurance, and pension. It has played a significant role in the opening of bank accounts for the poor.

The Indian Government launched the Direct Benefit Transfer Scheme to provide the benefits of subsidies and other transfers directly in the beneficiaries' bank accounts. The welfare scheme in which the DBT system is getting used is
LPG subsidy, Old Age Pension, Scholarship,
. And these all efforts allowed for the penetration of digital banking into rural India.

is a system that powers multiple bank accounts into a single mobile application (of any participating banks). It merges several banking features, seamless fund routing, and merchant payments into one hood. And this system is what makes digital transactions a simplified process. Cash-less monthly transactions via UPI have increased from

The Government of India has launched Digishala, a free Doordarshan DTH channel to educate and inform the people about the various modes of digital payments. It helps people understand UPI, USSD, AEPS, e-wallets, debit, and credit cards. This initiative will help the rural population of India know about these digital payment modes. Further, it will make them shift to becoming a cashless economy.
which everyone must have heard of, works on the

channel. It allows mobile banking transactions using the basic feature of mobile phones. Further, there is no need to have a mobile internet data facility for using USSD based mobile banking. And this initiative of the state helps in the financial inclusion of underbanked society in the mainstream banking services.

Aadhaar Enabled Payment System (AEPS) is a digital payment model that uses the Unique Identification Number for payment transfers. Additionally, it allows Aadhaar card-holders to perform the financial transaction at PoS centers. By using the Business Correspondent (BC)/Bank Mitra of any bank using the Aadhaar authentication.
This was a part of Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojna. This initiative has provided financial education programs to spread awareness of banking products and benefits.
In this year's budget, our FM announced earmarking Rs 1,500 crores for a proposed scheme to promote a digital mode of payment. This scheme is to further boost the digital revolution in the country.

Due to these combined initiatives. Further with the increase in internet and technological availability and affordability. The movement of Indian households in both rural and urban sectors is starting to show a shift from 90% cash-based to a larger rate of cashless economy.
can be undertaken by the government to improve the knowledge of e-transactions to the public, even the illiterate.
The banks must make sure that the
to encourage the poor to make use of the bank accounts.
Availability of ATMs in rural and suburban areas should be ensured. Just the availability of bank accounts alone cannot address the problem of India being overly dependent on cash.

SMEs should also start operating cashless. There are a lot of benefits for SMEs if they adopt the digital form of payments. For example, there will always a record if whatever transaction has been made. Companies like
are helping SMEs to adopt digital transformation.
Digital India: Why Businesses should Go Digital?

With a change in the world, there is a need for development in the economy of India. India has started to aim at a cashless economy. The paperless transaction movement will help the economy in immense ways.

And also, the flow of black money that results in an increase in **economic growth**.

Now, in the situation of this global coronavirus pandemic. The people of all statures got to know about the benefits of cash-less economic transactions.

Many of us from the events of Lockdowns and till now are afraid to use the currency notes. And we tend to sanitize them as soon as we reach our homes. Because we all fear that this currency may carry the virus, and that's why we don't want to use it.

Additionally, in the event of complete lockdown, many of us were unable to withdraw money from banks and ATMs. Due to this problem, we started using UPI and other digital payment options to purchase goods. And further, we understood the importance of these payment methods.

The same thing is happening with everyone around the world. So we all, with corporate and business houses, are shifting towards cashless transactions.

So to help you all understand the efforts Government is taking to make India a Cashless Economy, we have prepared this article. And we think that with this blog, you can assess what our state is doing for us and how we can contribute and improve it. Let's begin with it. 

- [**Past efforts of Indian Government for making a Cashless Economy.**](#Past-efforts-of-Indian-Government-for-making-a-Cashless-Economy.)
- [**Why should India be a Cashless Economy?**](#Why-should-India-be-a-Cashless-Economy?)
- [**Measures taken by the Indian Government?**](#Measures-taken-by-the-Indian-Government?)
- [**Way Forward**.](#Way-Forward)

<blog-image alt="cash less economy" image="money.jpg"></blog-image>

## Past efforts of Indian Government for making a Cashless Economy.

The Finance Minister announced in the [Union Budget 2019-20](https://www.iasexpress.net/mindmap-union-budget-2019-20-highlights-read-revise-faster/) that **TDS @ 2%** will get charged on cash withdrawals exceeding Rs.1 crore in a year from the bank account. The motive behind this particular announcement of our government was to discourage businesses' cash payments transactions. 

Additionally, to promote digital transactions among corporate houses. The government announced that companies with an annual turnover of over Rs.50 crore to offer low-cost digital payment modes. Moreover, the state is giving them the benefit of no additional or Merchant Discount Rate charges on them and their customers.

It is an excellent move by the Indian Government to incentivize people to adapt to the emerging cashless economy. 

Nearly 90% of all transactions in the Indian economy were dependent on cash before the pandemic. It's because of the large informal sector that employs 90% of the labor. India cannot become cashless unless this sector adapts to digital payments.

Incentivizing the people alone is not sufficient. The government needs to develop the supporting infrastructures and technologies for India to become a cashless economy.

## Why should India be a Cashless Economy?

India should shift to a cashless economy. The reasons for this statement are as follows:

- **Cash is expensive:** A lot of time and money goes into printing cash. RBI has spent Rs.32.1 billion on printing the currency. Also, there is the cost for the setting up of and maintaining of the ATMs. Furthermore, the paper currencies have shelf-life after which it needs to get replaced.
- **Cash is the driver of the shadow economy**: Cash is difficult to trace. Illegal activities like tax evasion, black money, etc can also be carried out with cash. In 2007, currency in circulation was almost on par with the bank deposits. However, in the last three years, the currency with Indians was more than the bank deposits by 50%. The amount of black money (unaccounted money) in India is 15-16 lakh crores. It may get used to finance illegal activities like terrorist activities, purchasing votes, smuggling, betting, trafficking, etc.
- **Enables financial inclusion and increased tax revenues**: A cashless economy makes it necessary for all citizens to have bank accounts. This will ensure a higher financial inclusion rate. It will also guarantee transparency in the transaction of money within the economy – minimizing the possibility of tax evasion exponentially.

## Measures taken by the Indian Government?

<blog-image alt="Indian Government steps for building a Cashless Economy" image="1-1.png"></blog-image>

<blog-image alt="Measures taken up by Government of Indian for building a Cashless Economy" image="2.png"></blog-image>

#### **Demonetization** 

Demonetisation drive has not curbed the black money. However, it had pushed India towards being a cashless economy. It has become a radical **"reform"** to transform India into a cashless economy. Paytm witnessed **5 million** daily usage post demonetization as opposed to their average transaction of **3 million.** 

Additionally, [**Paytm**](https://paytm.com/) was seeing a **700% increase** in its **overall traffic**. And a **1000% increase** in the amount of **money added to its account** within the first two days of post-demonetization. Further, **[Ola Money](https://www.olamoney.com/)** was seeing a **1500% increase** in its **e-wallet**.

#### **Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana**

One of the biggest financial inclusion initiatives in the world was launched in 2014. [Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana](https://pmjdy.gov.in/) is a national mission of [financial inclusion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_inclusion#:~:text=Financial%20inclusion%20is%20defined%20as,%2C%20equity%2C%20and%20insurance%20products.). It has an integrated approach to bring comprehensive financial inclusion and provide banking services to all households within the country.

This scheme ensures access to a range of financial services like availability of basic savings, bank accounts, access to need-based credit, insurance, and pension. It has played a significant role in the opening of bank accounts for the poor.

#### **Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)**

The Indian Government launched the Direct Benefit Transfer Scheme to provide the benefits of subsidies and other transfers directly in the beneficiaries' bank accounts. The welfare scheme in which the DBT system is getting used is **LPG subsidy, Old Age Pension, Scholarship,** [**MGNREGA**](https://nrega.nic.in/netnrega/home.aspx)**, etc**. And these all efforts allowed for the penetration of digital banking into rural India.

#### **Unified Payment Interface (UPI)**

[Unified Payment Interface (UPI)](https://www.npci.org.in/what-we-do/upi/product-overview) is a system that powers multiple bank accounts into a single mobile application (of any participating banks). It merges several banking features, seamless fund routing, and merchant payments into one hood. And this system is what makes digital transactions a simplified process. Cash-less monthly transactions via UPI have increased from **Nil to 754 million** in less than 3 years.

#### Digishala

The Government of India has launched Digishala, a free Doordarshan DTH channel to educate and inform the people about the various modes of digital payments. It helps people understand UPI, USSD, AEPS, e-wallets, debit, and credit cards. This initiative will help the rural population of India know about these digital payment modes. Further, it will make them shift to becoming a cashless economy.

#### Unstructured Supplementary Service Data (USSD)

The payment service of **\*99#,** which everyone must have heard of, works on the [Unstructured Supplementary Service Data (USSD)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unstructured_Supplementary_Service_Data) channel. It allows mobile banking transactions using the basic feature of mobile phones. Further, there is no need to have a mobile internet data facility for using USSD based mobile banking. And this initiative of the state helps in the financial inclusion of underbanked society in the mainstream banking services.

#### Aadhar Enabled Payment System (AEPS)

Aadhaar Enabled Payment System (AEPS) is a digital payment model that uses the Unique Identification Number for payment transfers. Additionally, it allows Aadhaar card-holders to perform the financial transaction at PoS centers. By using the Business Correspondent (BC)/Bank Mitra of any bank using the Aadhaar authentication.

#### **Financial Literacy Centres**

This was a part of Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojna. This initiative has provided financial education programs to spread awareness of banking products and benefits.

In this year's budget, our FM announced earmarking Rs 1,500 crores for a proposed scheme to promote a digital mode of payment. This scheme is to further boost the digital revolution in the country.

Due to these combined initiatives. Further with the increase in internet and technological availability and affordability. The movement of Indian households in both rural and urban sectors is starting to show a shift from 90% cash-based to a larger rate of cashless economy.

## Way Forward

- **A targeted financial education** **drive** can be undertaken by the government to improve the knowledge of e-transactions to the public, even the illiterate.
- The banks must make sure that the **transaction fee** is either **free** or **affordable** to all.
- The banks must encourage the **opening of zero balance accounts** to encourage the poor to make use of the bank accounts.
- The government must improve **internet connectivity** in **rural India** and **other isolated regions**.
- Availability of ATMs in rural and suburban areas should be ensured. Just the availability of bank accounts alone cannot address the problem of India being overly dependent on cash.
- SMEs should also start operating cashless. There are a lot of benefits for SMEs if they adopt the digital form of payments. For example, there will always a record if whatever transaction has been made. Companies like [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Cashless%20economy%3A%20How%20is%20it%20important%20for%20India) are helping SMEs to adopt digital transformation.

##### Read More - [Digital India: Why Businesses should Go Digital?](/blogs/digital-india-why-businesses-should-go-digital/?utm_source=Website%20Internal&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=%22Digital%20India%3A%20Why%20Businesses%20should%20Go%20Digital%3F%20%22)

With a change in the world, there is a need for development in the economy of India. India has started to aim at a cashless economy. The paperless transaction movement will help the economy in immense ways.

_data.text:
The Government of India’s organization [CBIC (Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs)](https://www.cbic.gov.in/) has released a notification some days earlier regarding the Change in GST Rate from **5%** to **12%** on the **Textiles (Fabrics and Apparel) sector**. Further, this hike in the GST Rates will be applicable on the Footwears also. 

And these changes in the GST Rates on Textiles and Footwears industries products will be effective from **January 1, 2022**.

The CBIC’s notification is a government step forward since its **[45th GST Council meeting](https://www.cbic.gov.in/resources//htdocs-cbec/press-release/PRESS_RELEASE_45.pdf)** held in September 2021. In the meeting, there was a discussion around the correction steps that should get made for the Inverted Duty Structure prevailing in the textile sector for a long time. Further, it is affecting a small section of the Textile and Apparel industry.

<blog-image alt="45th GST Council Meeting" image="gqaluui8_gst-council_625x300_17_September_21.jpg"></blog-image>

Also, in the September meeting only, there were discussions on this topic. But no decision got announced for the change in GST rates. So, the notification by CBIC on November 18, 2021, is the result of the 45th GST (Tax) Council Meeting.

## **List of products getting the effect of the CBIC’s new GST Rate change notification.**

<blog-image alt="GST Rates hike on Apparel and Textile Industry" image="1-568.jpg"></blog-image>

Now according to this new notification GST rate for the following type of products in reformed from 5% to 12% -

1. Woven fabrics. 
2. Sewing thread of man-made filaments, whether or not put up for retail sale, 
3. Synthetic filament yarn (other than sewing thread), not put up for retail sale, including synthetic monofilament of less than 67 Decitex. 
4. Artificial filament yarn (other than sewing thread), not put up for retail sale, including artificial monofilament of less than 67 Decitex. 
5. Knotted netting of twine, cordage, or rope, made up of fishing nets and other made up nets, of textile materials. 
6. Pile fabrics, including ― long pile fabrics and terry fabrics, knitted or crocheted.
7. Blankets and traveling rugs. 
8. Bed Linen. 
9. Table Linen.
10. Toilet Linen And Kitchen Linen. 
11. Curtains (including drapes) and Interior Blinds. 
12. Curtain or Bed Valances. 
13. Sacks and bags, of a kind used for the packing of goods.
14. Tarpaulins, awnings, and Sun-Blinds.
15. Tents.
16. Sails for Boats. 
17. Sailboards or Land-craft. 
18. Camping goods, Sets, consisting of woven fabric and yarn, whether or not with accessories, for making up into rugs, tapestries. 
19. Embroidered Tablecloths or Serviettes, or similar textile articles, put up in packings for retail sale, etc.

Apart from this particular list of articles, many goods are of concern to Textile and Apparels sector. And they will also have the same rate of tax.

<blog-image alt="GST rate changes on Footwears to 12%" image="3a1a8e88-2144-11ec-9efd-3aa1f7245a3d_1632946695233_1632946740117.jpg"></blog-image>

In the case of the Footwear Industry, the products of the sale value of Rs.1000 per pair were getting a GST rate of 5% earlier. But now, according to the notification, the GST rate for similar products is 12%.

Read More about - [What is GST Invoice & GST E-Invoicing-5 Problems SMEs face?](/blogs/what-is-gst-invoice-gst-e-invoicing-5-problems-smes-face/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+CBIC+notifies+change+in+GST+Rate+for+Textiles+%26+Footwear+products&utm_campaign=CBIC+notifies+change+in+GST+Rate+for+Textiles+%26+Footwear+products)

## **Conclusion**

The take on this particular notification of the Government and Union Finance Minister **[Smt. Nirmala Sitharaman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirmala_Sitharaman)** is that these changes are necessary to make a uniform rate for the whole industry. Also, helping those small part businesses of this sector that are facing the problems of different GST rates on their Inputs and output products. 

The **[Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT)](https://www.cait.in/)** and many similar organizations are upset with this hike in GST rates on Textile products. And are keeping their point of view in front of the government. This change is making the GST Tax structure more complicated.
