_data.text:
## What is Busy Software?

[Busy Infotech Pvt. Ltd.](https://busyaccountingsoftware.in/index.html) is a software company that provides an integrated business accounting and management solution for Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises (MSMEs). Busy accounting software helps its customers in their financial, GST filing, and payroll needs.

In 1993 the Busy Infotech Pvt. Ltd. started with the idea to empower all types of MSMEs by helping them manage their accounts and other business management processes. It has over 6 Lakhs users and over 1,00,000 installations worldwide. It is one of the leading business accounting software in India.

<blog-image alt="Busy software" image="hqdefault.jpg"></blog-image>

## What is TranZact?

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) is a zero-effort Digital Transformation tool that helps in digitizing the entire business process right from Inquiry to Sales & Dispatch. It is not just a Traditional ERP or Inventory Management software but is very much different from them. Because [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) also provides all the benefits and features of ERP and Inventory Management software like streaming of all business processes, faster documentation, inventory management, and financial assistance.

IIT and IIM graduates founded TranZact in 2017. The main idea behind [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) is that every Indian SME and Traditional Businesses should take a step forward in Digitalizing themselves entirely. And so they can achieve great fortune. Also, they can contribute successfully to the Digital India initiative of the country.

## How is TranZact different from Busy Software?

First of all, I would like to clarify that Busy is more focused on providing Accounting solutions. Many people get confused about the role of Busy software. Busy helps businesses managing their Payroll, GST Reports, Multi-Currency Accounting, Trading Excise Registers, Service Tax & TDS, MIS Reports & Analysis needs.

Read More about - [Is Tally enough for your SME](/blogs/is-tally-enough-for-your-sme/)

Whereas the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software helps manage the supply chain, manufacturing, services, financial and other processes of an organization. ERPs automate and simplify individual activities across a business or organization, such as accounting and procurement, project management, customer relationship management, risk management, compliance, and supply chain operations. So it is not wrong to say that Busy software is more of an Accounting solution. And not like the main ERPs as ERP software are not meant for SMEs.

Read More about - [ERP for SMEs? Think again](/blogs/erp-for-smes-think-again/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.)

Now let’s come to [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.), so it is also not ERP software. But is known as a Digital Transformation Tool. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) offers businesses services like Inventory Management, Document Processing, Batch Management, and also in procurement. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) helps in automating and managing all of the business’s core activities. And also in maintaining the proper flow of information among the different departments without any difficulty.

## How Busy and TranZact by using together can help SMEs?

Software Companies like [SAP](https://www.sap.com/india/index.html), [Oracle](https://www.oracle.com/in/index.html), [Odoo](https://www.odoo.com/) offers ERP and Business Management software as their products and are among the Best software in the world. But there is a problem that it is not suitable for organizations like small and medium scale businesses. Firstly, because the ERP implementation process is lengthy and complex and some extra features of ERPs are of no use for them. Secondly, this software is very costly, so many small businesses are unable to pay for them. So SMEs are left with many other choices which are easy to implement, affordable, and satisfy all their needs. And that is where TranZact and Busy come together to help them out.

1. Busy helps businesses in all their Accounting needs which is crucial to them. It is the best alternative to Tally. It also helps in payroll management that Tally does not provide. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) helps in the Document Preparation necessary for Accounting as it serves as proof of transaction. 
2. Busy software is easy to use, and it helps maintain all the year-round accounting and tax compliance-related information data required for Income Tax filings. For [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.), it helps to provide Chartered Accountants all documents with GST return filing details for the Auditing and Income Tax filling purposes digitally.
3. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) BI dashboards and other features help business owners to track all the business activities regularly and efficiently. Busy provides the Financial reports required for different purposes. Together with both these reports, it makes the Decision-making process for the owners data-driven and efficient.
4. Busy and [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) can serve as checking tools for each other for matching the balances of Creditors and Debtors of a business. And it can get verified that accounting entries are done correctly or not. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) helps, sending payment reminder emails to their debtors, and serves as a medium of conversation among two businesses.
5. Busy serves as the best tool for the Accounting Department of SMEs. And which also helps in managing their payroll management needs. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) is best for Purchase, Sales, Inventory, and other departments that need information that [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) offers. And it is the best software which serves as a medium for information flow from one of these departments to other. As it is easy to use and requires no extra learning to use it.

Read More about - [Oracle V/S TranZact: Which is Best Software for SMEs?](/blogs/oracle-v-s-tranzact-which-is-best-software-for-smes/)

## Conclusion

It is no doubt that software like SAP, Oracle, Odoo are best for big corporations and companies. But software like [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) and Busy are best for businesses having around 5 to 30 users. Busy for 28 years is serving the SMEs markets for their accounting needs. And is one of the best alternatives for Tally, which is the market leader of this industry. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) is one such tool that offers all the features which Busy and Tally doesn’t provide but was earlier prepare on Excel by the businesses. So [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) is replacing Excel and making the activities done on Excel digital and manageable. Therefore it is right to say that Busy and [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.) together offer all the services which SMEs need from ERP software and are affordable for them to use.

Read More about - [How Tally & TranZact together useful for SMEs.](/blogs/how-tally-tranzact-together-useful-for-smes/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How+Busy+Software+%26+TranZact+together+useful+for+SMEs.)

_data.description: Are you constantly trying to make a plan and ensure a smooth production process in your business. Optimize production process using these tips.
_data.title: How Can SMEs Optimize Production Process By Going Digital

children.value: Are you a manufacturing firm? If so, are you also constantly trying to make a plan and ensure that you have all the inputs ready for production. In this article, we'll try to summarize how you can optimize production process in your business using digital solution.

props.alt: How Can SMEs Optimize Production Process By Going Digital

children.value: is all about sidestepping the puddles on the manufacturing road that tend to waste any team's valuable time and resources. By filling these voids in once and for all, you can streamline the whole process and make the production flow smoother. When the goal is to optimize production process, you should aim at improving things that can be improved easily. Then gradually you can move towards voids that may be a little tricky to fill.
Easier said than done? The following guide highlights how a cloud-based integrated platform like
will help you optimize production process.

Keeping inventory is a major headache for every business. Occasional overstock causes unnecessary space shortage which causes a delay in fulfilling demand. Inventory management is the string of processes. It ensures that a manufacturing enterprise has the appropriate materials in the right quantity to complete the manufacturing process.
Inventory Management: Ultimate Guide for SMEs
How will a digital platform help

- All the inventory data of the company will be incorporated in one system where all teams can easily access it and be in sync with each other. It will enable businesses to control their logistics, operations, finance, and inventory from a singular system reducing errors and improving efficiency.

- Using an ERP to create and manage your BOM makes procurement of parts easy. During the design phase, while your engineering department will be busy at work designing and engineering a new product, your procurement team will have easy access to the EBOM. Thus orders can be placed early, giving you time to get your hands on these parts before production begins. Also since everything is managed in one system it automatically links to inventory. Therefore the purchasing department always knows what is needed, and what is already sitting on your shelves, ready for production.

You can simply set limits that represent a maximum amount and minimum inventory amount. When your stock of a certain product reaches the minimum level the system will give you an alert to reorder. Also, you can’t order more than the maximum limit. This helps to optimize production process and makes it efficient.

- Material requirements planning (MRP) is a planning and control system for inventory, production, and scheduling. Doing it in one platform synchronizes the flow of materials, components, and parts in a phased order system. It also combines and tracks hundreds of variables. For eg. Purchase orders, Sales orders, Shortage of materials, Due dates, Forecasts, Inventory, and Data.
6 ‘Must Haves’ Features For Your Inventory Software

It is incredibly hard to be informed on what levels of inventory are required from one quarter of the year to the next when all data is tracked in a manual manner. The forecasting department can make an educated guess, which is based on the previous data they have. However, this may be prone to human error. It also won't take into account current changes in the market for the manufacturing business.

Drawing inferences about customer trends in manual forecasting won't take into account how customer demands have changed. In that case, the results you will achieve via approximate guesses will be prone to error and less accurate.
How will the ERP system help

- If you implement a digital solution in your business, the software will notify you about these shifts in customer demand using both previous and real-time data. This makes forecasting future customer demands very easy and effortless. Also, results are more accurate and reliable as opposed to employing manual methods.

- It offers built-in business intelligence (BI) features and reporting capabilities, Role-tailored dashboards, charts, and other visualizations. Also, it offers detailed reporting templates and streamlines data capture for analysis
Effortless Communication with Customers and Suppliers

Many SMEs operate on different software cobbled together that either overlap or produce a gap between functional areas.  As a result, communication does not take place at critical times for equally critical processes. The use of spreadsheets, repetitive data entry, and different units of measure from department to department can almost make it seem like the communication that does take place is being done using different “languages". Data from department to department then is not always transferable in raw form and must be “translated”, or converted, for useful analysis. This procedure repeats as it moves to the next department making it all cumbersome. This results in discouraging communication between teams. When teams are not able to communicate amongst themselves how will they be able to communicate well with customers?
How can an ERP system help in effective communication?

- One way a digital solution improves communication is by creating a single version of the truth.  Data is unified in a single database that is not specific to executives, or purchasing, or manufacturing.  The data is available to everyone in the team.  The unified database removes the need for different data implementation between departments and brings everyone under a common umbrella. This results in streamlining communication.

– A second way that digital solutions can improve communication is that everyone is a part of the new platform Effective communication within an organization doesn't leave anyone out. Each functional area can communicate effectively because of data standardization.  It is no longer just a conversation between manufacturing and scheduling alone.  Now,
finance, inventory control, purchasing, supply chain, and executives can see the system in action and understand their place and functionality within the system

.  By including all departments in its core functionality and calculations, a manufacturing ERP system can help everyone feel like part of a unified team working in the same direction communication becomes more effective in this way.
Bringing about a transformation within an organization is obviously difficult than it looks. However, a Cloud integrated platform like
is a must-have tool for SMEs. It helps them stay at par with other competitors in a cut-throat market.

To stay ahead in the curve, Manufacturing SMEs need to utilize all the right tools they can get their hands on to boost efficiency. Be it the design stage, the manufacturing stage, or the distribution process; the ultimate goal is to have as few obstacles as possible. This has to be achieved while keeping labor costs minimum and manufacturing premier quality products that are what the customer wants.

In the modern manufacturing landscape, digital solutions have the capacity and then some to fill the void between cutting-edge technology popular these days and conventional manufacturing processes. The end result is the business taking enormous strides on the path of revolutionary innovation.

Many SMEs operate on different software cobbled together that either overlap or produce a gap between functional areas.  As a result, communication does not take place at critical times for equally critical processes. Data from department to department then is not always transferable in raw form and must be “translated”, or converted, for useful analysis. children.value: India is at the forefront of the global economic stage.
in double digits next year and expected to follow that up with the highest 6.8% rise in the FY23
.  Policy support and vaccines are expected to lift

activity across the world. How can India turn its latest growth upswing into a sustained rise in living standards and better jobs for its fast-growing labor force? The task is not easy. Very few countries have managed a successful transition from low- to middle- and then high-income status. South Korea is one of them — but it is a much smaller economy. In this article, we'll see how digitization in the manufacturing sector can help India grow.
Digital industry can unlock tremendous value for India.
India’s manufacturing sector needs to give a stronger contribution to economic growth and job creation. The Government of India recognizes this. Its
plan aims to increase the GDP share of manufacturing to 25% of GDP by 2025–30, from 17% currently. As a result it can create up to 90 million additional jobs.
The two pillars of digital transformation in the industry are

. Companies must be attentive to the changing landscape of their industry. They should also be sure to count on the right talent in order to carry out new business models. Training should also be provided to retain the workforce.
5 Ways Digitization Can Optimize Your Company’s Profitability

is the application of digital capabilities to processes, products, and assets. This should in return enhance efficiency, increase customer value, manage risk and navigate through new revenue generation opportunities. This transformation is global and therefore involves adopting digital technologies for both internal operations and external ones. This including sales, marketing, and support efforts. Therefore, to adapt, companies must fundamentally change the way they operate. They should be willing to accept cultural change and rethink their present business methods.
Digital talent and capabilities are key to the transformation and exploitation of new business strategy.

study confirms this by claiming that companies need limitless, adaptable humans to thrive in their ever-changing world. The study recommends companies stop viewing their applications, infrastructures, and employees as independent entities. To move on and see them as cross-cutting, and to consider them interconnected systems giving rise to the term industry 5.0.
Digitization in the industry provides an opportunity to combine practices and ways of doing that result in new techniques, skills, and sources of income. Here are some of its key benefits:

Digitization of your firm can save you money beyond just by increasing productivity. Digital technology allows you to track your energy usage in real-time. Therefore, with this information, you can see what process uses the most energy. To sum up this gives you the chance to make changes and save money on energy costs in your facility. The result boosts your profits.

Through real-time communications, you can find out where your supplies are at any given time. As a result, this improved supply chain information can help you better manage your operations. Improvements in supply chain management are especially clear in short-notice aspects of the system.

To keep your facility up longer, predict when to conduct maintenance rather than reacting to breakdowns. Regular audits of processes will ensure everything is running smoothly. For example, A large chemical facility digitized its maintenance and saw an 80 percent drop in unexpected downtime.
Digitization will definitely increase productivity of your team. Since work will be assigned already and all the discrepancies will also be known, the team will be better at its work.

With product development, you can increase innovation by cutting the time from development to deployment. Above all, using real-time data, product development can more rapidly meet changing demands. Even higher-tech data evaluation can predict when trends will change, similar to how predictive maintenance works. To sum up, meeting customer demands quickly can reduce the number of unsold products, lowering waste.

Operating a facility can be done from a centralized location. This is because it improves the ability of the business owners to see all lines and take control where needed. When working with a digital solution, a business owner can be everywhere in the plant at once. Thanks to controls at his or her fingertips, enacting decisions immediately is simple, cutting on downtime.
How Can SMEs Optimize Production Process By Going Digital

Digitizing makes your storage facilities smarter. This is to say that you can also make your warehouses and document storage centers more efficient and reliable. Inventory can also be managed more efficiently with no low or dead stocks as it'll be easier to track via a digital solution.
The Importance of Keeping an Accurate Inventory

Digitalization is reinventing businesses and capturing unique competitive advantages, but companies continue to hold back when the time comes to change their current business models. Digital transformation has been a kind of slogan for many top managers in recent years. According to a

study, 79% of corporate strategists claim to be digitalizing their businesses to create new revenue streams. But so far change has been slow and less than half of the companies that claim to be transitioned bring their digital initiatives to the core of their strategy.
There are a lot of web solutions available for SMEs to digitize their business. But before making a decision it's important to ensure if that solution is affordable for your business and easy to use.

is one such solution. It has helped over 1000 SMEs streamline their business processes from customer inquiry to dispatch. In today's world, digital transformation is not an option. It is necessary to escape the comfort zone, reinvent themselves and compete in this world overrun by technological advances.

_data.text:
India is at the forefront of the global economic stage. **India** is the only major **economy** expected to **grow** in double digits next year and expected to follow that up with the highest 6.8% rise in the FY23 [fiscal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiscal_policy).  Policy support and vaccines are expected to lift **economic** activity across the world. How can India turn its latest growth upswing into a sustained rise in living standards and better jobs for its fast-growing labor force? The task is not easy. Very few countries have managed a successful transition from low- to middle- and then high-income status. South Korea is one of them — but it is a much smaller economy. In this article, we'll see how digitization in the manufacturing sector can help India grow.

#### Digital industry can unlock tremendous value for India.

India’s manufacturing sector needs to give a stronger contribution to economic growth and job creation. The Government of India recognizes this. Its [Make in India](http://www.makeinindia.com/) plan aims to increase the GDP share of manufacturing to 25% of GDP by 2025–30, from 17% currently. As a result it can create up to 90 million additional jobs.

<blog-image alt="" image="make-in-india-logo.jpg"></blog-image>

The two pillars of digital transformation in the industry are **innovation** and **disruption**. Companies must be attentive to the changing landscape of their industry. They should also be sure to count on the right talent in order to carry out new business models. Training should also be provided to retain the workforce.

Read More - [5 Ways Digitization Can Optimize Your Company’s Profitability](/blogs/digitization-to-increase-profitability/?utm_source=Website%20Internal&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How%20Digitization%20and%20Domestic%20Manufacturing%20Can%20Help%20India%20Grow)

[Digitization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digitization) is the application of digital capabilities to processes, products, and assets. This should in return enhance efficiency, increase customer value, manage risk and navigate through new revenue generation opportunities. This transformation is global and therefore involves adopting digital technologies for both internal operations and external ones. This including sales, marketing, and support efforts. Therefore, to adapt, companies must fundamentally change the way they operate. They should be willing to accept cultural change and rethink their present business methods.

#### **Digital talent and capabilities are key to the transformation and exploitation of new business strategy.**

An [Accenture](https://www.accenture.com/in-en) study confirms this by claiming that companies need limitless, adaptable humans to thrive in their ever-changing world. The study recommends companies stop viewing their applications, infrastructures, and employees as independent entities. To move on and see them as cross-cutting, and to consider them interconnected systems giving rise to the term industry 5.0.

Digitization in the industry provides an opportunity to combine practices and ways of doing that result in new techniques, skills, and sources of income. Here are some of its key benefits:

##### 1\. Reduce Energy Usage

Digitization of your firm can save you money beyond just by increasing productivity. Digital technology allows you to track your energy usage in real-time. Therefore, with this information, you can see what process uses the most energy. To sum up this gives you the chance to make changes and save money on energy costs in your facility. The result boosts your profits.

Read More - [Digital Documentation: 5 Benefits for SMEs](/blogs/digital-documentation-5-benefits-for-smes/?utm_source=Website%20Internal&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How%20Digitization%20and%20Domestic%20Manufacturing%20Can%20Help%20India%20Grow)

##### 2\. **Improve Communications With Suppliers**

Through real-time communications, you can find out where your supplies are at any given time. As a result, this improved supply chain information can help you better manage your operations. Improvements in supply chain management are especially clear in short-notice aspects of the system.

##### 3\. **Predict Maintenance**

To keep your facility up longer, predict when to conduct maintenance rather than reacting to breakdowns. Regular audits of processes will ensure everything is running smoothly. For example, A large chemical facility digitized its maintenance and saw an 80 percent drop in unexpected downtime.

##### 4\. **Raise Productivity**

Digitization will definitely increase productivity of your team. Since work will be assigned already and all the discrepancies will also be known, the team will be better at its work.

##### 5\. **Increase Innovation**

With product development, you can increase innovation by cutting the time from development to deployment. Above all, using real-time data, product development can more rapidly meet changing demands. Even higher-tech data evaluation can predict when trends will change, similar to how predictive maintenance works. To sum up, meeting customer demands quickly can reduce the number of unsold products, lowering waste.

##### 6\. Boost Efficiency

Operating a facility can be done from a centralized location. This is because it improves the ability of the business owners to see all lines and take control where needed. When working with a digital solution, a business owner can be everywhere in the plant at once. Thanks to controls at his or her fingertips, enacting decisions immediately is simple, cutting on downtime.

Read More - [How Can SMEs Optimize Production Process By Going Digital](/blogs/how-can-smes-optimize-production-process-by-going-digital/?utm_source=Website%20Internal&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How%20Digitization%20and%20Domestic%20Manufacturing%20Can%20Help%20India%20Grow)

##### 7\. **Make Your Storage Smarter**

Digitizing makes your storage facilities smarter. This is to say that you can also make your warehouses and document storage centers more efficient and reliable. Inventory can also be managed more efficiently with no low or dead stocks as it'll be easier to track via a digital solution.

Read More - [The Importance of Keeping an Accurate Inventory](/blogs/the-importance-of-keeping-an-accurate-inventory/?utm_source=Website%20Internal&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How%20Digitization%20and%20Domestic%20Manufacturing%20Can%20Help%20India%20Grow)

#### Way Forward

Digitalization is reinventing businesses and capturing unique competitive advantages, but companies continue to hold back when the time comes to change their current business models. Digital transformation has been a kind of slogan for many top managers in recent years. According to a [Gartner](https://www.gartner.com/en) study, 79% of corporate strategists claim to be digitalizing their businesses to create new revenue streams. But so far change has been slow and less than half of the companies that claim to be transitioned bring their digital initiatives to the core of their strategy.

There are a lot of web solutions available for SMEs to digitize their business. But before making a decision it's important to ensure if that solution is affordable for your business and easy to use. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=How%20Digitization%20and%20Domestic%20manufacturing%20Can%20Help%20India%20Grow) is one such solution. It has helped over 1000 SMEs streamline their business processes from customer inquiry to dispatch. In today's world, digital transformation is not an option. It is necessary to escape the comfort zone, reinvent themselves and compete in this world overrun by technological advances.

Read More - [Digital India: Why Businesses should Go Digital?](/blogs/digital-india-why-businesses-should-go-digital/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Tally%20Enough%20For%20Your%20SME%3F)

#### Myth 3- Accounting Softwares are very easy to Implement

Hmm, to be honest, I doubt. Many Accounting Softwares like [Tally](https://tallysolutions.com/) and [Busy](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=78i2Do5SLVw) only require to install in the system and is then ready to use. Still, the process for its users in the organization is a little tricky. Firstly they have to learn about **"How to use the software"** and then get acquainted with it. So that is why it's a little tough to implement like any other new thing or system when used for the first time in the organization. And this process becomes a bit annoying. Generally, not many Big Accounting software companies provide On-Boarding customer support to all types of customers. At [TranZact](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Tally%20Enough%20For%20Your%20SME%3F), our team helps our customers with every step of On-Boarding. And we guide all the Users of the product on How To Use it and make the Implementation process easy.

Read More - [Why Does ERP Implementation Take So Much Time](/blogs/why-does-erp-implementation-take-so-much-time/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Tally%20Enough%20For%20Your%20SME%3F)

#### Myth 4- Accounting is very simple, and can be done without any help.

Let me be very frank with you in this regard. Even though after the onset of accounting softwares, it has become easier than earlier days. But if someone gets stuck with some complicated transactions, then you will have to consult your [CA](https://www.icai.org/). May be, getting your hands dipped into digitization will be a great step in this regard. Our team offers you all the necessary digitizing tools which will in turn help you in all such regards. Moreover, when it comes to customization of billing or inventory management, accounting softwares wont prove that helpful to you.

#### Final conclusion

I don't strongly recommend to you using just an accounting software for your SME. Its good to have one, but its not enough certainly. I would rather vote for getting your business digitized instead of just relying upon the accounting softwares. Now if you are still in doubt, then let me clarify it in some more detail. To flourish your SME business, you would require to have as much digital technology as possible. Going digital, has stopped being a buzz word now. Nearly, 50% of world's population is active on internet. If you want to be on the same page with global tendencies, then you need to follow the digitizing trends. You will have to digitize your data, as well as other applications which would help you to conduct business in a more hassle free manner.

A lot of companies, including [Paypal](https://www.google.com/aclk?sa=l&ai=DChcSEwjG0vOSrNPxAhUGypYKHcyACQYYABAAGgJ0bA&sig=AOD64_1Qbr6V39a8RGCL_0KA7Yg8ur050A&q&adurl&ved=2ahUKEwjmruuSrNPxAhVRU30KHQrzCYQQ0Qx6BAgCEAE), [Uber](https://m.uber.com/), [Airbnb](https://www.airbnb.co.in/), [OYO](https://www.google.com/aclk?sa=l&ai=DChcSEwj_482brNPxAhXJrpYKHfejAy0YABAAGgJ0bA&ae=2&sig=AOD64_2Z9w2xwTh6skT_rwOjRIIeUDT8ag&q&adurl&ved=2ahUKEwjbxcCbrNPxAhUBb30KHbp6D3gQ0Qx6BAgCEAE), and a lot more, have shifted their operations into an environment of newly built Digitized models. This conveys that no matter what industry your SME belongs to, you can implement digital solutions into your business. If you are struggling to implement the current ongoing digital trends, then [TranZact](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Tally%20Enough%20For%20Your%20SME%3F) is for you. Why are SME owners concerned with cloud security?
Well because it is not typically in their hands. When you store a data into the cloud, it is stored in some server of the

, which is situated may be in another nation, or may be even in another continent. Moreover, the data which is being stored over there, is in the hands of some third party organisation. Let’s say, the cloud can be
in some other case, and irrespective of the organisation, now your data is kept with some other company.

Now, you have got no other chance apart from trusting their security services. A lot of times, being an SME owner, makes it risky to trust such services. Whether you send the data automatically (think apps that sync to the cloud) or you upload photos to social media, the end result is that it’s all there somewhere being logged and stored. So its pretty much clear, that in some or the other way, it is not in your direct control.
What are the potential risks of the data stored in the cloud?
Now that you know, data is being stored at some other place, so there are a lot of risks involved. Let’s analyse what sort of risks are involved in such kind of data storages.
The first and the foremost risk of such storage is,

Whether they would handle the information to the other party is upto the company which is providing the service. It depends upon the situation, so you can't be dead sure that your data is basically kept a secret.
Some people would say, they have

, and they are not committing any crime such that they would consider keeping things private. For those guys, let me tell you, may be its not important for you, but the same service is being accessed by a lot of people who might be having dire need of privacy. So as per my opinion, digital privacy is a need and a fundamental right as well. You might not be doing anything sinful, but that doesn’t end the need of having some basic privacy feature in the cloud services.
Data Security In Digital Solution: 3 Tips For Business Owners
What are the benefits of cloud services as an SME owner?

On the flip side, let’s talk about the benefits of the cloud services. If you count on the negative aspects, may be its just a handful of points. But on the other hand, there are numerous benefits of cloud storage. It is actually an added backup option which can help you a lot when your primary device gets stolen, or it gets damaged due to some accident. Cloud storages, are usually very heavily protected and any random hacker won’t be able to penetrate its security. Your mobile phone or your PC/laptop has a lot more vulnerability to cyber-attacks than any cloud server can ever have.

Second biggest benefit of cloud storage is, having more economic feasibility than purchasing new hard disks every time you require some extra storage. Let’s consider the fact that how much per month Google or Microsoft cloud services are charging you for the storage they are giving you. And now, on the contrary, just think of how much money you would have to pump in, to purchase those many USBs and SSD drives and hard disks. I bet, the latter amount is much more higher. So in this sense, ease of access is far more in cloud services, than in your local storage devices.
So, what is the final verdict if you are an SME owner?

if you are an SME owner, then I have few points as suggestion for cloud safety. It is no doubt a great idea, with a lot more security than the storages which you are using locally. _data.text:
<blog-image alt="data_security_in_cloud" image="CloudMalware-900x506-1.jpg"></blog-image>

It is not always easy for an SME owner to trust the cloud services for their data storage. I have seen many people who doubt the security measures of cloud. In this article, I am going to discuss about the insecurities that SME owners usually face while using cloud services.

#### Why are SME owners concerned with cloud security?

<blog-image alt="cloud_security" image="Cloud-storage-for-Wendy2-768x545-1.png"></blog-image>

Well because it is not typically in their hands. When you store a data into the cloud, it is stored in some server of the [cloud service provider](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-in/overview/what-is-a-cloud-provider/), which is situated may be in another nation, or may be even in another continent. Moreover, the data which is being stored over there, is in the hands of some third party organisation. Let’s say, the cloud can be [Google drive](https://drive.google.com/drive/my-drive) in some case, or [icloud](https://www.icloud.com/) in some other case, and irrespective of the organisation, now your data is kept with some other company.

Now, you have got no other chance apart from trusting their security services. A lot of times, being an SME owner, makes it risky to trust such services. Whether you send the data automatically (think apps that sync to the cloud) or you upload photos to social media, the end result is that it’s all there somewhere being logged and stored. So its pretty much clear, that in some or the other way, it is not in your direct control.

#### What are the potential risks of the data stored in the cloud?

Now that you know, data is being stored at some other place, so there are a lot of risks involved. Let’s analyse what sort of risks are involved in such kind of data storages.

1. The first and the foremost risk of such storage is, **Privacy.** Each year, the government agencies, few investigation agencies and many more independent entities, request data from these cloud service providers. Whether they would handle the information to the other party is upto the company which is providing the service. It depends upon the situation, so you can't be dead sure that your data is basically kept a secret.
2. Some people would say, they have **nothing to hide**, and they are not committing any crime such that they would consider keeping things private. For those guys, let me tell you, may be its not important for you, but the same service is being accessed by a lot of people who might be having dire need of privacy. So as per my opinion, digital privacy is a need and a fundamental right as well. You might not be doing anything sinful, but that doesn’t end the need of having some basic privacy feature in the cloud services.

Read More - [Data Security In Digital Solution: 3 Tips For Business Owners](/blogs/data-security-in-digital-solution-3-tips-for-business-owners/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20cloud%20storage%20safe%20for%20SME%3F)

#### What are the benefits of cloud services as an SME owner?

On the flip side, let’s talk about the benefits of the cloud services. If you count on the negative aspects, may be its just a handful of points. But on the other hand, there are numerous benefits of cloud storage. It is actually an added backup option which can help you a lot when your primary device gets stolen, or it gets damaged due to some accident. Cloud storages, are usually very heavily protected and any random hacker won’t be able to penetrate its security. Your mobile phone or your PC/laptop has a lot more vulnerability to cyber-attacks than any cloud server can ever have.

Second biggest benefit of cloud storage is, having more economic feasibility than purchasing new hard disks every time you require some extra storage. Let’s consider the fact that how much per month Google or Microsoft cloud services are charging you for the storage they are giving you. And now, on the contrary, just think of how much money you would have to pump in, to purchase those many USBs and SSD drives and hard disks. I bet, the latter amount is much more higher. So in this sense, ease of access is far more in cloud services, than in your local storage devices.

#### So, what is the final verdict if you are an SME owner?

if you are an SME owner, then I have few points as suggestion for cloud safety. It is no doubt a great idea, with a lot more security than the storages which you are using locally. But then, since it is being stored into a third party server, you need to be extra cautious while storing anything which is sensitive and private. My personal recommendation for cloud storage for better safety is

1. Enable [2 factor authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multi-factor_authentication).
2. Change passwords frequently.
3. Choose a strong password, the strength of the password should be considerably high.

So that was a brief article regarding cloud safety and security concerns. Here at tranzact, we do consider your concern regarding cloud safety. There is no doubt [TranZact](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=is_your_business_data_safe_in_cloud) has a great digital security infrastructure, do try it once. Stay tuned, this is Ayush, signing off here, to meet you next time.

Read More - [Cloud ERP Solutions are Secure or Not?](/blogs/cloud-erp-solutions-are-secure-or-not?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20cloud%20storage%20safe%20for%20SME%3F)

children.value: Are you having second thoughts about going forward with a digital solution for your business? It's absolutely fine. Being resistant to any kind of change is a part of human nature. But change in business processes is something that is necessary with time in any organization.

props.alt: Is Your SME Business Ready For A Digital Solution

children.value: We believe there are a few factors that you should consider before going forward with a digital solution for your business.
1. Excel Sheets Are Too Many And Too Long

If you need to make a list of anything, it’s tempting to see Excel may be your first resort. After all, it’s only a small list of items for yourself or a few close colleagues. What begins as a small project in Excel grows into something massive, at which point you could also face speed and stability issues or even a development problem you can’t solve.

tasks often present significant challenges, such as organization, implementation, classification of files, database management, user collaboration, and more. In conclusion, All it takes to break the structure of a database is placing data in the wrong area, typing data inconsistently, or even having two people working on the same sheet. Several things can go wrong, causing time delays and possible data loss. So this something that really should be avoided in business and you should move forward with a digital solution in your business.
6 Reasons Why Excel Doesn’t Work For Inventory Management

With the onset of pandemic, 'how to communicate' has become one of the biggest problems in any SME manufacturing company. Meanwhile you just can't seem to find a way to collaborate with your employees or look after what they are doing working remotely. This is where a digital solution comes to your rescue. Through a digital solution you can-
Automate routine customer-related tasks and process of returns
Access to order history, delivery status, etc. to everyone
Unifiy the data by providing a centralized data repository
Draws information from suppliers and clients

When you have less customers and less products keeping a track of inventory using Excel sheets is good. But when you have a lot of products and a lot of inventory moving in and out you should look for something that can automate the tedious data entry process. Therefore this is exactly what a digital solution will do. Here is how digital inventory management solution will do

Inventory management allows you to properly plan your replenishment orders. Your inventory quantity must be accurate so when the signal to buy or make more is received. An inventory management system allows you to categorize parts which help easily order the right quantity. Your goal here is fewer transactions so you order enough to satisfy all the demands seen in the next few months.
: You can quickly see and react to surplus inventory. Should you return the item? Can you contact the customer and ask for another order to use up the surplus?
You save time and money through better inventory organization using your digital inventory management system. Better organization can lead to improved customer satisfaction.
The Importance of Keeping an Accurate Inventory
Difficultly in maintaining cashflow because of late payments

Do you forget to track down customers for their due payments? Tracking down customers for payments is one tricky job. You can lose track of pending payments as more and more come along. A digital solution will never let you forget a pending payment and you can easily share invoices with your customers through emails or WhatsApp. Tracking down also becomes a lot easier because all the orders can be viewed sorted by time and date.
Digital India: Why Businesses should Go Digital?

Digitalization is reinventing businesses and capturing unique competitive advantages, but companies continue to hold back when the time comes to change their current business models. According to a Gartner study, 79% of corporate strategists claim to be digitalizing their businesses to create new revenue streams. In 2020 this has become faster as digital was the only way business could be conducted.
There are a lot of web solutions available for SMEs to digitize their business. But before making a decision it’s important to ensure if that solution is affordable for your business and easy to use.

is one such solution. It has helped over 1000 SMEs streamline their business processes from customer inquiry to dispatch. In today’s world, digital transformation is not an option. It is necessary to escape the comfort zone, reinvent themselves and compete in this world.

_data.text:
Are you having second thoughts about going forward with a digital solution for your business? It's absolutely fine. Being resistant to any kind of change is a part of human nature. But change in business processes is something that is necessary with time in any organization.

<blog-image alt="Is Your SME Business Ready For A Digital Solution" image="https___blogs-images.forbes.com_peterbendorsamuel_files_2019_07_GettyImages-1091738564-1200x887-1.jpg"></blog-image>

We believe there are a few factors that you should consider before going forward with a digital solution for your business.

#### 1\. Excel Sheets Are Too Many And Too Long

If you need to make a list of anything, it’s tempting to see Excel may be your first resort. After all, it’s only a small list of items for yourself or a few close colleagues. What begins as a small project in Excel grows into something massive, at which point you could also face speed and stability issues or even a development problem you can’t solve.

Furthermore, [big data management](https://hbr.org/2012/10/big-data-the-management-revolution) tasks often present significant challenges, such as organization, implementation, classification of files, database management, user collaboration, and more. In conclusion, All it takes to break the structure of a database is placing data in the wrong area, typing data inconsistently, or even having two people working on the same sheet. Several things can go wrong, causing time delays and possible data loss. So this something that really should be avoided in business and you should move forward with a digital solution in your business.

Read More - [6 Reasons Why Excel Doesn’t Work For Inventory Management](/blogs/6-reasons-why-excel-doesnt-work-for-inventory-management/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Your%20SME%20Business%20Ready%20For%20A%20Digital%20Solution)

#### 2\. Communication gap between employees

With the onset of pandemic, 'how to communicate' has become one of the biggest problems in any SME manufacturing company. Meanwhile you just can't seem to find a way to collaborate with your employees or look after what they are doing working remotely. This is where a digital solution comes to your rescue. Through a digital solution you can-

- Automate routine customer-related tasks and process of returns
- Offer 24 x 7 customer self-service support
- Access to order history, delivery status, etc. to everyone
- Unifiy the data by providing a centralized data repository
- Draws information from suppliers and clients
- Take better data-backed decisions

#### 3\. Running out of inventory

When you have less customers and less products keeping a track of inventory using Excel sheets is good. But when you have a lot of products and a lot of inventory moving in and out you should look for something that can automate the tedious data entry process. Therefore this is exactly what a digital solution will do. Here is how digital inventory management solution will do

- **Planning replenishment orders:** Inventory management allows you to properly plan your replenishment orders. Your inventory quantity must be accurate so when the signal to buy or make more is received. An inventory management system allows you to categorize parts which help easily order the right quantity. Your goal here is fewer transactions so you order enough to satisfy all the demands seen in the next few months.
- **Surplus inventory management**: You can quickly see and react to surplus inventory. Should you return the item? Can you contact the customer and ask for another order to use up the surplus?
- **Business Savings:** You save time and money through better inventory organization using your digital inventory management system. Better organization can lead to improved customer satisfaction.

Read More - [The Importance of Keeping an Accurate Inventory](/blogs/the-importance-of-keeping-an-accurate-inventory/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Your%20SME%20Business%20Ready%20For%20A%20Digital%20Solution)

#### 4\. **Difficultly in maintaining cashflow because of late payments**

Do you forget to track down customers for their due payments? Tracking down customers for payments is one tricky job. You can lose track of pending payments as more and more come along. A digital solution will never let you forget a pending payment and you can easily share invoices with your customers through emails or WhatsApp. Tracking down also becomes a lot easier because all the orders can be viewed sorted by time and date.

Read More - [Digital India: Why Businesses should Go Digital?](/blogs/digital-india-why-businesses-should-go-digital/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Is%20Your%20SME%20Business%20Ready%20For%20A%20Digital%20Solution)

#### Way Forward

Digitalization is reinventing businesses and capturing unique competitive advantages, but companies continue to hold back when the time comes to change their current business models. According to a Gartner study, 79% of corporate strategists claim to be digitalizing their businesses to create new revenue streams. In 2020 this has become faster as digital was the only way business could be conducted.

There are a lot of web solutions available for SMEs to digitize their business. But before making a decision it’s important to ensure if that solution is affordable for your business and easy to use. [TranZact](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=digital_solution) is one such solution. It has helped over 1000 SMEs streamline their business processes from customer inquiry to dispatch. In today’s world, digital transformation is not an option. It is necessary to escape the comfort zone, reinvent themselves and compete in this world.

, it is more important than ever to have an inventory management system in place to help navigate your business through this pandemic. has provided numerous lessons, including for all aspects of the supply chain. So, here are four inventory management strategies supply chain leaders and inventory managers can use going forward.
Inventory Management: Ultimate Guide for SMEs
Today's leaders must pay even closer attention to customers' demands than they ever have. As the

began, companies experienced abrupt shifts in customer demand and channel preferences. Because many organizations that weren't prepared likely failed their customer's expectations. Data makes the world go around — it’s as simple as that. The vast majority of businesses are now running primarily by computers and technology. The majority of financial records, for businesses and individuals, are tracked and stored through big data nowadays.

Inventory is no different, of course. Understanding how data is shaping inventory management will help you become more efficient and knowledgeable. In addition, the most significant advantage big data offers inventory management is in improving efficiency. Inventory operations include many small, interconnected processes. If just one of them lags, it can cause issues throughout the entire process.

If you come across products covered in dust from the turn of the millennium while organizing your warehouses, then it’s a great time to review your company’s slow-moving inventory. Moving forward, your business must have a well-thought-out and dynamic plan for its inventory procurement process. In general, reviewing inventory is something you should do as many times as possible in your business. It is more important at this time as the demand is fluctuating vastly in these uncertain times.
How to use excel for inventory management

, you must be sitting for hours reviewing sheets for any possible errors. Digital inventory management doesn't require you to do that as it automatically updates inventory after each purchase order is passed. This reduces the room for errors. It also improves the visibility of the stock as compared to long Excel sheets.
6 Reasons Why Excel Doesn’t Work For Inventory Management

Another critical inventory management strategy is understanding what products are in demand right now. In some cases, this pandemic gives you an opportunity to pivot the business and leverage core competencies in a different direction. Last year left a lot of business owners feeling uncertain about their immediate future. Some companies are trying to manage this situation by reinventing their business model to help them stay afloat in the short term. You would have an overabundance of inventory, subject to spoilage, and nowhere to distribute it. One thing that can be done in this situation is to explore different markets and act fast on manufacturing products that are in demand. Of course, you will also need to stop or reduce the frequency of ordering raw material that is no longer being produced.
You may also have an opportunity to simplify your business model. Let’s say that, normally, your inventory is made up of 1,000

contain seasonal items, specialty items, and items that require a complex production process. During this period, focus on the products in your inventory that are your main source of revenue. Rework your inventory to allow for as limited SKUs which will help with slow-moving inventory management and cost reduction. Therefore, limiting your company’s product offering and focusing on the items that drive revenue will help ensure accurate inventory purchasing. Keep in mind, this is not a typical year for operations, and the prior year’s sales trends and product purchase history may not be the best indicators to use when discussing procurement.
The Importance of Keeping an Accurate Inventory

The pandemic is a fluid situation. To be operationally effective, you must work with stakeholders to continually engage in forecasting activities and make adjustments when necessary. There are a number of different avenues for a manufacturing and distribution business to navigate through this environment. Carefully considering the most efficient and effective course of action to keep your business operating in the short term may ensure the success of your business in the long term.

In these difficult times, you can just not be relying on your inventory registers or excel sheets to make important decisions. You need an easy-to-use and affordable inventory management platform like

_data.text:
As a manufacturing and distribution business, you understand that inventory is the core of your enterprise. At the time of [Covid-19](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus), it is more important than ever to have an inventory management system in place to help navigate your business through this pandemic. There are a number of different inventory management strategies a business can implement to ensure proper management. The hard part is finding the ones that work best for your business. It is important to start taking the right steps to develop a plan, implement it, actively monitor progress and follow that plan throughout the remainder of your fiscal year.

<blog-image alt="" image="1-1.jpeg"></blog-image>

## 4 Critical Inventory Management Strategies

The [COVID-19 pandemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus) has provided numerous lessons, including for all aspects of the supply chain. So, here are four inventory management strategies supply chain leaders and inventory managers can use going forward.

Read More - [Inventory Management: Ultimate Guide for SMEs](https://bit.ly/3C2XyyA)

#### 1\. Pay attention to consumer signals

Today's leaders must pay even closer attention to customers' demands than they ever have. As the [COVID-19 pandemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus) began, companies experienced abrupt shifts in customer demand and channel preferences. Because many organizations that weren't prepared likely failed their customer's expectations. To have avoided this, companies needed as much visibility as possible into their inventories. A proper digital inventory management system gives a scope of demand forecasting.

Businesses should also question whether the demand signals they're receiving from their end customers in the short and medium-term are realistic. That is a plan for now and the future.

#### 2\. Focus on data

Data makes the world go around — it’s as simple as that. The vast majority of businesses are now running primarily by computers and technology. The majority of financial records, for businesses and individuals, are tracked and stored through big data nowadays.

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tenUbEqzJt4?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

Inventory is no different, of course. Understanding how data is shaping inventory management will help you become more efficient and knowledgeable. In addition, the most significant advantage big data offers inventory management is in improving efficiency. Inventory operations include many small, interconnected processes. If just one of them lags, it can cause issues throughout the entire process.

#### 3\. **Review slow-moving inventory**

If you come across products covered in dust from the turn of the millennium while organizing your warehouses, then it’s a great time to review your company’s slow-moving inventory. Moving forward, your business must have a well-thought-out and dynamic plan for its inventory procurement process. In general, reviewing inventory is something you should do as many times as possible in your business. It is more important at this time as the demand is fluctuating vastly in these uncertain times.

Read More - [How to use excel for inventory management](https://bit.ly/3H6Tp0s)

If you use [Excel Sheets for inventory management](https://bit.ly/3H6Tp0s), you must be sitting for hours reviewing sheets for any possible errors. Digital inventory management doesn't require you to do that as it automatically updates inventory after each purchase order is passed. This reduces the room for errors. It also improves the visibility of the stock as compared to long Excel sheets.

Read More - [6 Reasons Why Excel Doesn’t Work For Inventory Management](https://bit.ly/30bTJdv)

#### 4\. **Areas Of Opportunity To Pivot**

Another critical inventory management strategy is understanding what products are in demand right now. In some cases, this pandemic gives you an opportunity to pivot the business and leverage core competencies in a different direction. Last year left a lot of business owners feeling uncertain about their immediate future. Some companies are trying to manage this situation by reinventing their business model to help them stay afloat in the short term. You would have an overabundance of inventory, subject to spoilage, and nowhere to distribute it. One thing that can be done in this situation is to explore different markets and act fast on manufacturing products that are in demand. Of course, you will also need to stop or reduce the frequency of ordering raw material that is no longer being produced.

You may also have an opportunity to simplify your business model. Let’s say that, normally, your inventory is made up of 1,000 [**stock-keeping units (SKUs).**](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/stock-keeping-unit-sku.asp#:~:text=A%20stock%2Dkeeping%20unit%20,eight%2Dor%2Dso%20characters.) A number of these [**SKUs**](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/stock-keeping-unit-sku.asp#:~:text=A%20stock%2Dkeeping%20unit%20,eight%2Dor%2Dso%20characters.) contain seasonal items, specialty items, and items that require a complex production process. During this period, focus on the products in your inventory that are your main source of revenue. Rework your inventory to allow for as limited SKUs which will help with slow-moving inventory management and cost reduction. Therefore, limiting your company’s product offering and focusing on the items that drive revenue will help ensure accurate inventory purchasing. Keep in mind, this is not a typical year for operations, and the prior year’s sales trends and product purchase history may not be the best indicators to use when discussing procurement.

Read More - [The Importance of Keeping an Accurate Inventory](https://bit.ly/3F3nJYc)

## Way Forward

The pandemic is a fluid situation. To be operationally effective, you must work with stakeholders to continually engage in forecasting activities and make adjustments when necessary. There are a number of different avenues for a manufacturing and distribution business to navigate through this environment. Carefully considering the most efficient and effective course of action to keep your business operating in the short term may ensure the success of your business in the long term.

In these difficult times, you can just not be relying on your inventory registers or excel sheets to make important decisions. You need an easy-to-use and affordable inventory management platform like **[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Lessons+from+COVID-19%3A+4+Inventory+Management+Strategies&utm_campaign=Lessons+from+COVID-19%3A+4+Inventory+Management+Strategies)**.

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RgoTUV3fJ8A?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

**[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Lessons+from+COVID-19%3A+4+Inventory+Management+Strategies&utm_campaign=Lessons+from+COVID-19%3A+4+Inventory+Management+Strategies)** has been in the business of providing a digital solution to SMEs for over 3 years now. What's best about the product is that its basic version is free to use forever.

children.value: With the rise of modernization and industrialization, small businesses and companies started to compete to achieve two goals of

for themselves. That's all they are working for to increase their organization's value and financial stability to pay off all their liabilities. And for that, they have to maintain both a healthy cash inflow and cash outflow system. To manage their cash inflows, they can rely on the Sundry Debtors Management process. But for their cash outflow issue, they have to maintain their Cash Purchases and Cash Payments to Sundry Creditors. A large amount of leakages happens from the payments sent to creditors. So managing the payments to creditors task becomes difficult for businesses. That's why the Sundry Creditors Management process comes into place.

So if you have come here to read this article, you want to know about the Sundry Creditors Management process. And there's some possibility that you might have some background to it. But in this guide, we will tell you about the whole thing right from Beginning to end for all our readers. So let's get begin with it.

The individuals or small businesses or firms or companies who receive any products or services from any business organization without immediate payment but on a credit basis are known as Sundry Creditors for that particular business organization. They are getting credit on the security of a promise or agreement to businesses to pay off their liabilities in the future. It is a collective name or account type given to all the lenders and trade creditors.

Let's take a quick example. ABC Co. Ltd. supplies some quantity of Raw Materials to XYZ Co. Ltd. on a credit basis for 15 days. And this transaction was pre-approved by both parties on set terms and conditions. Now for XYZ Co. Ltd., his supplier stand as Trade Creditor and contributes to other current liabilities. Along these lines, when XYZ Co. Ltd. gets more credit supplies from its suppliers, then collectively, they all are known as Sundry Creditors.

Sundry Creditors Management is a technique of efficiently handling the companies' unpaid claims to third-party vendors over credit purchases. It helps in managing the vast range of payments and processes plenty of invoices. And this timely management of cash outflow in the form of payments to creditors helps maintain a healthy working capital situation in the organization.
The concept about Sundry Creditors and their management process, which's explained above, may have given you some idea about it. Now let's understand why it is necessary and needs to get implemented.
Sustaining a proper Cash Flow system -

Through the Sundry Creditors Management process, management of the cash flow system in the organization becomes easy. It helps in providing creditors with their payments after optimally exhausting the supplier's credit facilities. With the use of this facility, cash outflows get streamline with the credit period utilizing the money accordingly.

With the large number of processes occurring in the company, it gets challenging to focus on just one thing. So to go on through each invoice to know about the payment details towards creditors becomes extremely difficult. And to help companies out with that, they need to record each invoice with all its terms and conditions, and then only the tracking of their payments is possible. So this process can become easy and efficient with the use of Sundry Creditor's Management process. Because it helps to determine the exact amounts owed to creditors, avoid overdue charges, penalty or late fees due to delay in payments.

The suppliers are the essential stakeholders for any organization as they help out in primary needs of inputs for our products. So it becomes necessary to maintain good relations with them. And this is done by providing timely payments for their goods and services. So then only suppliers will supply the continuous flow of goods and services and offer other facilities like trade discounts and credits limits necessary for operating the company.

So as you all know, the importance of a cash flow system in an organization is necessary to make plans to manage it efficiently. And to help in this, sundry creditors management provides information about the time to time expenses and liabilities. Accordingly, companies can formulate plans for short and long periods as to how to pay it off.
How to Implement Sundry Creditors Management?
After understanding sundry creditors and their management, why it is necessary, you all will want to know about its implementation. So let’s start with it.

There are two approaches that businesses can use to implement a sundry debtors management process. First is the Traditional or Manual Approach, in which companies early perform the whole process manually by appointing different employees. And the collection of data and preparation of reports for the management’s understanding, whole thing done on paper.

that has the features of performing sundry creditors management. It will help to provide real-time information about the dues, further refraining from any fraud and theft in the business. Because it helps to store all contracts and related documents in one place, monitoring overdue and providing automated reminders.
Debtors Management in SME Business – Ultimate Guide

After providing you all information about sundry creditors and their management, I must guide you on selecting the different approach for its implementation. So if the businesses, whether small or large, go for the manual process, they will face difficulties in managing and providing the correct information. Also, the process will take a lot of time to complete. And in some cases, a simple graphical depiction of the complete data will not be possible.

So with these all difficulties the second approach is the more suitable option. The use of the software will make it easy and fast for the users to view the data in a much simpler manner. With the rise of modernization and industrialization, small businesses and companies started to compete to achieve two goals of [**Wealth Maximization**](https://www.wallstreetmojo.com/wealth-maximization/) and good [**Cash Liquidity**](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/cash_position.asp) [**positions**](https://www.thebalancesmb.com/liquidity-position-analysis-with-ratios-393233) for themselves. That's all they are working for to increase their organization's value and financial stability to pay off all their liabilities. And for that, they have to maintain both a healthy cash inflow and cash outflow system. To manage their cash inflows, they can rely on the Sundry Debtors Management process. But for their cash outflow issue, they have to maintain their Cash Purchases and Cash Payments to Sundry Creditors. A large amount of leakages happens from the payments sent to creditors. So managing the payments to creditors task becomes difficult for businesses. That's why the Sundry Creditors Management process comes into place.

So if you have come here to read this article, you want to know about the Sundry Creditors Management process. And there's some possibility that you might have some background to it. But in this guide, we will tell you about the whole thing right from Beginning to end for all our readers. So let's get begin with it.

## What are Sundry Creditors?

The individuals or small businesses or firms or companies who receive any products or services from any business organization without immediate payment but on a credit basis are known as Sundry Creditors for that particular business organization. They are getting credit on the security of a promise or agreement to businesses to pay off their liabilities in the future. It is a collective name or account type given to all the lenders and trade creditors.

Let's take a quick example. ABC Co. Ltd. supplies some quantity of Raw Materials to XYZ Co. Ltd. on a credit basis for 15 days. And this transaction was pre-approved by both parties on set terms and conditions. Now for XYZ Co. Ltd., his supplier stand as Trade Creditor and contributes to other current liabilities. Along these lines, when XYZ Co. Ltd. gets more credit supplies from its suppliers, then collectively, they all are known as Sundry Creditors.

## What is Sundry Creditors Management?

Sundry Creditors Management is a technique of efficiently handling the companies' unpaid claims to third-party vendors over credit purchases. It helps in managing the vast range of payments and processes plenty of invoices. And this timely management of cash outflow in the form of payments to creditors helps maintain a healthy working capital situation in the organization.

## Why is it Important & Needed?

The concept about Sundry Creditors and their management process, which's explained above, may have given you some idea about it. Now let's understand why it is necessary and needs to get implemented.

##### 1\. **Sustaining a proper Cash Flow system -**

Through the Sundry Creditors Management process, management of the cash flow system in the organization becomes easy. It helps in providing creditors with their payments after optimally exhausting the supplier's credit facilities. With the use of this facility, cash outflows get streamline with the credit period utilizing the money accordingly.

##### 2\. **Tracking Sundry Creditor's dues -** 

With the large number of processes occurring in the company, it gets challenging to focus on just one thing. So to go on through each invoice to know about the payment details towards creditors becomes extremely difficult. And to help companies out with that, they need to record each invoice with all its terms and conditions, and then only the tracking of their payments is possible. So this process can become easy and efficient with the use of Sundry Creditor's Management process. Because it helps to determine the exact amounts owed to creditors, avoid overdue charges, penalty or late fees due to delay in payments.

##### 3\. **Maintaining good relations with Suppliers -** 

The suppliers are the essential stakeholders for any organization as they help out in primary needs of inputs for our products. So it becomes necessary to maintain good relations with them. And this is done by providing timely payments for their goods and services. So then only suppliers will supply the continuous flow of goods and services and offer other facilities like trade discounts and credits limits necessary for operating the company. 

##### 4\. **Formulating Cash management policies -** 

So as you all know, the importance of a cash flow system in an organization is necessary to make plans to manage it efficiently. And to help in this, sundry creditors management provides information about the time to time expenses and liabilities. Accordingly, companies can formulate plans for short and long periods as to how to pay it off.

## How to Implement Sundry Creditors Management?

After understanding sundry creditors and their management, why it is necessary, you all will want to know about its implementation. So let’s start with it.

There are two approaches that businesses can use to implement a sundry debtors management process. First is the Traditional or Manual Approach, in which companies early perform the whole process manually by appointing different employees. And the collection of data and preparation of reports for the management’s understanding, whole thing done on paper.

The second approach is using [automation software](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Sundry+Debtors+Management+in+SME+Business+-+Ultimate+Guide) that has the features of performing sundry creditors management. It will help to provide real-time information about the dues, further refraining from any fraud and theft in the business. Because it helps to store all contracts and related documents in one place, monitoring overdue and providing automated reminders.

Read More about - Sundry [Debtors Management in SME Business – Ultimate Guide](/blogs/sundry-debtors-management-in-sme-business-ultimate-guide/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Managing+Sundry+Creditors+in+SME+Business+-+Ultimate+Guide)

## Way Forward

After providing you all information about sundry creditors and their management, I must guide you on selecting the different approach for its implementation. So if the businesses, whether small or large, go for the manual process, they will face difficulties in managing and providing the correct information. Also, the process will take a lot of time to complete. And in some cases, a simple graphical depiction of the complete data will not be possible.

So with these all difficulties the second approach is the more suitable option. The use of the software will make it easy and fast for the users to view the data in a much simpler manner. And for that firms, can choose different software solutions available in the market. But should not go for software that only provides for just this particular need. Further, they shall go for a solution that satisfies all their needs and fits their company’s size and nature of business. And [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Managing+Sundry+Creditors+in+SME+Business+-+Ultimate+Guide) is one such option that is suitable for SMEs.

So firms should choose this software or any other software only if they provide for their nature and size. Otherwise, go for other solutions available in the market if it suits them.
