_data.text:
Manufacturing businesses all over the world needed a system to incorporate all their needs for planning inventory and production management, for which they were using [**Re-order Point**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reorder_point)**,** [**Re-order Quantity**](https://scholar.cu.edu.eg/?q=mahmoudarafa/files/inventory_management_-_4.pdf)**, and** [**Economic Order Quantity**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_order_quantity) methods. And in around the 1950s, a system started to develop, which was Material Requirement Planning. It was from then till now been the system or process, the essence for planning out the production process and taking care of the inventory management needs. In 1975, [Mr. Joseph Orlicky](https://www.qad.com/blogs/2018/05/joseph-orlicky-hero-materials-requirements-planning) published a book name, **Material Requirements Planning - The New Way of Life in Production and** [**Inventory Management**,](/blogs/inventory-management-ultimate-guide-for-smes/?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) and it has been the foundation for companies to learn and implement this MRP system. 

Now let's understand the Material Resource Planning (MRP) concept and how it benefits all businesses.

## What is Material Requirement or Resource Planning (MRP)?

Material Requirements Planning is a process that helps in [procurement planning](/use-cases/category/mrp-use-cases?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) on the basis of orders, [stock management](/blogs/ultimate-guide-for-smes-about-stock-inventory-reconciliation/?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs), [inventory control](/blogs/inventory-control-6-best-techniques-to-follow/?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs), [production planning](/blogs/production-planning-and-control-ultimate-guide-for-smesproduction-planning-and-control-ultimate-guide-for-smes/?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs), scheduling, and cost reduction. It helps in determining the facts like - 

1. **What raw materials are required to complete the order?**
2. **What is your current Stock position, and if it is suitable to fulfill your orders or not?**
3. **How many [Purchase Orders](/use-cases/category/purchase-order-status?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) have you already given for the stock?**

<blog-image alt="Material Requirement Planning (MRP)" image="Untitled-design-4.png"></blog-image>

Further, many people have a confusion that **Material Requirements Planning (or MRP I)** and **Material Resources Planning (or MRP II)** are two different terms. But it is not the case. Actually, these terms are almost alike. Many times they are used interchangeably. The difference is that **MRP II** further provides the information using the accounting and other data, through which you can forecast and analyze the manufacturing requirements cost and capacity.

## How do the MRP systems work?

As you all know about the development of the MRP concept from the 1950s. But in reality, the companies started using it around 1989. Because at that point, only the software became present that was providing the MRP module service. Now you must understand that this concept is only available for businesses with MRP software help.

This system involves the help of inputs like a Bill of materials (BOM) for manufacturing concerns, stock reports, purchase orders, and inventory costs. The BOM provides the raw material components information. It further helps in calculating the total quantity of materials required for manufacturing particular demand of finished goods.

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Gbl7O6xJOSw?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

**How TranZact's MRP module helps in Procurement Planning.**

Then the next step with the stock reports help is to ascertain that the inventory available in stores is sufficient for the particular order requirement or not. Further, if the inventory levels are shorter. Then how much additional quantity of materials should get purchased gets calculated.

With the help of Purchase Orders, the required quantity which has already been ordered becomes clear. And it becomes clear that which components and their quantities need to get re-order.

## Benefits of the Material Requirement Planning system.

This Material Requirement Planning process helps businesses in these particular ways -

- **Purchase Planning -** With the help of input documents like the Bill of Materials and Order Confirmation, the exact quantities of input materials and other resources can get estimated. Further, the business can plan out its purchase process and re-order time efficiently.
- **Production Planning -** MRP helps in planning and scheduling the manufacturing operations. Further, it does it in such a way that does not involve use of excessive inventories.
- **Inventory Control -** Material Resource Planning helps in controlling your stocks. So, that you can hold the least amount of inventory in your warehouses. Additionally, that makes it easier lower down the inventory holding costs. 
- **Cost Reduction -** It helps in decreasing the working capital costs. Further by decreasing the inventory levels and optimum utilizing the production resources.

## Way Forward

So, in short, this is the procedure that every MRP module follows to help businesses in their needs. And to perform these, all activities manually becomes an impossible task. That's why there is a need for a software solution that provides the Material Resource Planning function. And for Indian SMEs and Manufacturing concerns, [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) is there to help them out in this task.

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) is a zero-effort digital transformation tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. Its MRP module helps companies in easing out their procurement, production, purchasing planning process.

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O72TUcapY6U?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

Additionally, its MRP Dashboard feature helps in forecasting the demand of their products and their raw materials. And with all these features, business management can make data-driven decisions.

The [TranZact team](/our-team?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) provides their digitizing tool on a [Freemium policy.](/why-free-forever?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) Because we want our customers to take a step forward in digitizing their businesses [without having to think over silly amounts of money.](/pricing?utm_source=Website+Blog&utm_medium=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=Material+Requirement+Planning+%28MRP%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs)

Further, the organizations must choose TranZact or any other software only when it meets all their requirements. They should check whether it is suitable for their business size and nature. And if the software satisfies all these conditions. Then only should implement it in their organization.

_data.text:
On Sunday last week, the **[Ministry of Finance](https://finmin.nic.in/)** has released some announcements on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FinMinIndia/status/1469955198260891648?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1469955198260891648%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.livemint.com%2Fnews%2Findia%2Fgood-news-for-gst-taxpayers-govt-reduces-compliance-burden-details-here-11639301898862.html) about the Relaxations for GST taxpayers. According to these announcements, the taxpayers who have their **[Annual Aggregate Turnover (AATO)](https://www.cbic.gov.in/resources//htdocs-cbec/gst/51_GST_Flyer_Chapter7.pdf;jsessionid=6337AF169A0E6194084CEEC0DAAB321D)** up to **Rs.5 crores** did not require to file the reconciliation statement in Form **GSTR-9C** for **F.Y. 2020-21** onwards.

Further, the [Ministry of Finance](https://twitter.com/FinMinIndia) made many more announcements regarding the GSTR-9 and GSTR-9C filing. But before talking about that, let's understand more about Form GSTR-9 and GSTR-9C.

Read more about - [GST Update: GSTN Launches Improvements in GSTR-1.](/blogs/gst-update-gstn-launches-improvements-in-gstr-1/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C&utm_campaign=Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C)

<blog-image alt="GSTR-9C | TranZact ( Ministry of Finance  Twitter update for Compliance Burden reduced for GST Taxpayers" image="FGZUdAtWQAkIdr6.jpeg"></blog-image>

## What is Form GSTR-9?

The Form GSTR-9 is a return statement that registered taxpayers need to file every once a year. In GSTR-9, the taxpayers need to provide consolidated details of **CGST, SGST, and IGST supplies** made during the entire year. 

## What is Form GSTR-9C?

The Form GSTR-9C is a statement of reconciliation between the GSTR-9 Annual Return for that specific Financial Year and the figures as per the audited annual Financial Statements of the taxpayer. In this form, the registered taxpayers need to file a copy of the audited annual accounts along with a reconciliation statement. Both these documents need to be duly certified by a Chartered or Cost Accountant.

Read More about - [E-Way Bill – Ultimate Guide for SMEs About E-Way Bill Rules.](/blogs/e-way-bill-ultimate-guide-for-smes-about-e-way-bill-rules/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C&utm_campaign=Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C)

## Who all needs to file GSTR-9 and GSTR-9C?

According to the [CGST Act, 2017](https://www.cbic.gov.in/resources/htdocs-cbec/gst/cgst-act.pdf), all registered taxpayers need to file Form GSTR-9. But with the continuous changes happening over the years in the CGST Act with the help of circular and notifications, now, the taxpayers who have their **[AATO](https://www.legalraasta.com/gst/aggregate-turnover-gst/)** up to Rs.2 crores, the filing of GSTR-9 is optional for them. And the taxpayers who have their AATO of more than Rs.2 Crore in that Financial Year needs to mandatory file the GSTR-9 form.

![GSTR-9C | TranZact ( Ministry of Finance  Twitter update for Compliance Burden reduced for GST Taxpayers" (https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FGZbUe7X0AEiyQs?format=jpg&name=900x900)

Till now, for GSTR-9C, the taxpayers who have their AATO up to Rs.2 crores did not have to file this form. But the taxpayers who have their AATO of more than Rs.2 Crore in that Financial Year needed to file the GSTR-9C. 

Read More about - [What is GST Invoice & GST E-Invoicing-5 Problems SMEs face?](/blogs/what-is-gst-invoice-gst-e-invoicing-5-problems-smes-face/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C&utm_campaign=Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C)

## Effects of this Announcement?

According to this latest announcement of the Ministry of Finance, the taxpayers who have their **[Annual Aggregate Turnover limit](https://www.legalraasta.com/gst/aggregate-turnover-gst/) up to Rs.5 Crore** did not mandatorily require to file form GSTR-9C.

Further, the Taxpayers with AATO above Rs.5 crores can now self-certify the reconciliation statement instead of getting it certified by a [**Chartered or Cost accountant**](https://chetanmalikclasses.com/cost-accountants-vs-chartered-accountant/). And all these changes are applicable from F.Y. 2020-21 and onwards.

Read more about - [CBIC notifies change in GST Rate for Textiles & Footwear products.](/blogs/cbic-notifies-change-in-gst-rate-for-textiles-footwear-products/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C&utm_campaign=Ministry+of+Finance+Reduces+Compliance+Burden+in+GSTR-9C)

SAP V/s TranZact: Which is Best Software for SMEs?

_data.text:
## What is Oracle?

[Oracle](https://www.oracle.com/in/index.html) is an American Multinational Software company that offers Enterprise software products, database software and technologies, and cloud engineered systems. The Enterprise Software products provide [ERP solutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enterprise_resource_planning) that help in Human Resource Management, Customer Relationship Management, Enterprise Planning Management, and Supply Chain Management.

Oracle Corporation was founded in 1977 by [Larry Ellison](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Ellison), [Bob Miner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Miner), and [Ed Oates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Oates) under the name **Software Development Laboratories** (**SDL**). Also, Oracle provides Database Management Services that help maintain the online transactions and manage the workloads in the system. 

## What is [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=SAP%20V%2Fs%20TranZact)?

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F) is a zero-effort Digital Transformation tool that helps in digitizing the entire business process right from Inquiry to Sales & Dispatch. It is not just a Traditional ERP or Inventory Management software but is very much different from them. Because TranZact also provides all the benefits and features of ERP and Inventory Management software like streaming of all business processes, faster documentation, inventory management, and financial assistance.

IIT and IIM graduates founded [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F) in 2017. The main idea behind TranZact is that every Indian SME and Traditional Businesses should take a step forward in Digitalizing themselves entirely. And so they can achieve great fortune. Also, they can contribute successfully to the [Digital India](https://www.digitalindia.gov.in/) initiative of the country.

## Comparison Between Oracle & TranZact

[<blog-image alt="Oracle V/S TranZact: Which is Best Software for SMEs?" image="1-1.png"></blog-image>](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F)

[<blog-image alt="Oracle V/S TranZact: Which is Best Software for SMEs?" image="2-1.png"></blog-image>](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F)

1. **Product Availability** \- Oracle provides its software solutions both on Cloud and On-Premise basis for its all type of users. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F) provides its software on a Cloud basis to its users and uses Amazon AWS cloud service provider to ensure security for it.
2. **UserBase** - Oracle is best suitable for mid-size businesses and large corporations. It suits the need of organizations that have users around 50 to 100+ users. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F) is suitable for small and medium enterprises and Manufacturing concerns. Organizations that have around 5 to 30 users are using TranZact, and it suits their needs. 
3. **Software Implementation** - Oracle ERP solutions implementation process is lengthy and takes around 11 to 14 months to fully complete. Proper planning is done regarding which modules are to get implemented in the organization, so it takes a long time. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F) implementation process takes around 2 weeks. Also, their team guides the users throughout the implementation process.
4. **Pricing** - Oracle provides all the ERP modules in its solutions which are only used by large companies and not small enterprises, so their pricing policy is high compared to others. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F) believes in their [Freemium policy](/?utm_source=Website+&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F), so they offer the product for unlimited access for Free.

## Conclusion

From the above discussion, it is very much clear that Oracle is helpful software and is of great use for Large corporations. Also, it is complex software, so requires trained users for using it. The cost and time for setting it up are very much high. And due to these issues, it is not suitable for SMEs and Traditional Businesses. But for [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F), comes out as the best alternative for small and medium-scale businesses. And it can provide for all the business needs in the best possible way.

Read More about - [SAP V/s TranZact: Which is Best Software for SMEs?](/blogs/sap-v-s-tranzact-which-is-best-software-for-smes/?utm_source=Website+Internal&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Oracle+V%2FS+TranZact%3A+Which+is+Best+Software+for+SMEs%3F)

_data.text:
## What is Order Management?

Order Management is simply a process of receiving, tracking, and fulfilling an order and sending an order to a customer or intermediary. It includes the cycle of people, processes, and suppliers to create a positive customer experience. Whenever any customer places an order, it starts automatically and ends when they receive their package.

## What is Order Management Cycle?

The Order Management cycle is a well-defined process that starts with the initiative of a customer that it wants to buy a product. So the beginning process if you read for an E-commerce business and Manufacturing concern differs a lot. In the Manufacturing business, the cycle starts with the Real-time Inventory check procedure. To ascertain the fact that there is inventory enough to satisfy the needs of an order or not. And if it is then, only the business accepts that order, and it gets placed further. And in the E-commerce business, the cycle starts when the customer places an order. But for both types of companies, it ends when the customer receives its order and gets fully satisfied with it.

Now quickly, we should look at each stage of the order management cycle.

[<blog-image alt="Order Management Cycle" image="Untitled-design-1024x1024.png"></blog-image>](/use-cases/category/order-management?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++)

###### 1\. **Inventory Availability Check**

Many manufacturing companies provide acceptance to customer's orders only after checking their inventories. So that they know the fact that the appropriate amount of stock is present to fulfill the order. So for them, the Order Management cycle starts with this stage only.

###### 2\. **Order Placement** 

The customers, after they receive an acceptance from their suppliers through Quotations or any other thing, place their orders from different places, at different times, across every available channel. 

###### 3\. **Order Routing** 

Just as the customers place their order and it gets to receive process of passing this information to the concerned departments starts. Accordingly, the departments begin preparing the order, and other requirements are met.

###### 4\. **Shipping & Delivery**

After the departments prepare the customer's order, it gets packed up and ready for delivery and shipping to the customer's place.

###### 5\. **Order Tracking**  

It is the last stage when the order gets shipped to the customer. A tracking number is provided both to the supplier and buyer to track the order. And after it reaches the customer's place, a Follow-up is done whether the customer is satisfied with the order or not.

Read More about - [Streamline Inventory Management Easily Using These Tips.](/blogs/streamline-inventory-management-easily-using-these-tips/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++)

## Problems SMEs have with the Order Management process.

Now let's end the wait for you all about the main thing you wanted to know through this article. And let's talk about the problems SMEs may have with the Order Management process. So to give you all a heads-up, the problem SMEs have is arising because they have not digitalized themselves. Therefore only they are having these following problems:

[<blog-image alt="Order Management: 3 Biggest Challenges SMEs faces" image="Order-Management-1.png"></blog-image>](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++)

### 1\. Visibility Problems of Orders

SME owners have the problem that they are unable to locate the order at which stage of the Order Management Cycle is it right now. And due to this, the Management has no clear understanding of whether orders can be delivered on time or not. This confusion can lead to the other customer's order to delay and will ultimately result in a loss for the company.

### 2\. **Streamlining** Problem of Orders

SMEs try to manage their order fulfilling process majorly through the manual process. They tend to record all the data related to raw material usage, transfer of goods to different processes, and other activity on paper. And this creates a possibility of Human-Error, which is very common to happen. It also requires more resources and labor for manual data entry and creates a communication problem among different departments. Because the departments can not get any updates regarding the order cycle as all the data gets maintained on paper. And to get information about this they have to use special measures to get access to it.

So the solution to this whole problem is that the whole business process, right from inquiry to dispatch and further, should get digitalized. And this initiative will streamline all the business activities, and then this problem will cease to exist.

### 3\. Tracking Problem of Orders

The Tracking Problems which SMEs have is one of the biggest problems and is similar to the **Visibility Problems of Orders** mentioned above. So the main concerns of SMEs are whether the order got dispatched at on right time or not. And at which process it is taking a lot of time. Also, whether the correct quantity and quality of product got sent to the buyer or not. 

And these problems of SMEs tend to increase at a faster rate because of the Manual recording and Data Entry process applied. Because it leaves no choice for the persons in charge to conduct manual tracking of the Order Management process, which takes lots of time and is many times seen as inefficient.

## Conclusion

SMEs are facing these particular problems in the overall structure of the order management cycle. And many more other issues they face in distinct stage processes are linked with these 3 main problems only. That is ultimately affecting the Decision-Making Process of the top management and owners of the business. Due to the delayed and sometimes wrong or misinformation, they cannot take decisions efficiently. Because they are not getting the perfect idea of what is going on in their organization about customers' orders. Also, the main goal of Order Management, which is to enhance the customer experience and satisfaction with the products and services, becomes unachievable.

So the solution to all these problems with the Order Management process is to automate the whole business core activities. And it can be done by the [digitalization](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonbloomberg/2018/04/29/digitization-digitalization-and-digital-transformation-confuse-them-at-your-peril/?sh=4230d7ba2f2c) of the organization just by introduction and implementation of new technologies and software. And to aid the [digitization](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonbloomberg/2018/04/29/digitization-digitalization-and-digital-transformation-confuse-them-at-your-peril/?sh=4230d7ba2f2c) process, there are many software solutions available in the market.

Companies and small businesses should choose software considering the nature and size of their organization that the software adds value to them and does not generate problems. And one such software option for small and medium-sized businesses is [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++). [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++) is a digital transformation tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++) team believes in a [Freemium policy](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Order+Management%3A+3+Biggest+Challenges+SMEs+faces++). As they want every Indian SME to use their software without worrying about silly amounts of money. So businesses should choose the software depending upon their needs that it can get fully satisfied or not.

_data.description: So you may know why Purchase Order is important but do you know what challenges SMEs face while preparing POs manually. Let's find out.
_data.title: 4 Facts & Challenges SMEs should know about Purchase Order

toc.text: Problems which SMEs face with Purchase Orders?

children.value: Small and Medium-sized businesses from the old times have depended upon the Manual way of providing Purchase Orders to their Suppliers on paper. And in some occasions, there were observations like no written Purchase Order was present just, Verbal Communication over a phone call was enough.

This type of behavior in the organization created confusion for both sides of buyers and suppliers. So after incurring some losses in the business, SMEs tend to understand why making Purchase Order is essential for the proper functioning of their companies. And from then, the use of Purchase Orders is seen a lot in SMEs.

So now, if you have come to this article, you want to know about the problems small businesses face with Purchase Order. And before going to talk about let's understand what exactly a Purchase Order means.

Purchase Order (PO) is a commercial document made by a Buyer to present the first official offer to the Seller that they want to place an order with the vendors or suppliers of a product and services.

The PO contains a purchase request and the product-related details such as the types of goods, quantity, price, and other terms & conditions which are essential for the transaction. In the absence of a contract between the Buyer and Supplier, the Purchase Order serves as a valid contract when the Vendor gives a proper acceptance to the Purchase Order.
So after understanding what the PO or Purchase Order means. Let's find out the problems which SMEs face with regards to POs.
Problems which SMEs face with Purchase Orders?

Generally, SMEs and manufacturing concerns make their purchase orders manually on paper or sometimes use Excel. And this behavior of businesses of not automating themselves becomes the biggest problem for them. So the Problems which SMEs with Purchase Orders when prepared manually are as follows:-
No Streamlining of POs is possible

The PO's, if made manually on paper or Excel, it becomes a little hectic process to follow the Purchase Flow procedures within the organization. Taking the approvals of the person in charge for authorizing the PO within the company will require an extra effort from the person preparing it as he has to send it for approval through mails. And this is an example of an unnecessary step in the Purchase Flow.

If SMEs make POs manually, they have to send the document to all the parties concerned in the department series of separate emails to inform them about it. And if one department may not get the intimation about it due to some mistake, then the whole business might suffer because of lack of communication among departments. To give a glimpse of what problem SMEs might face, let's take an example of the Finance department when it didn't receive any news about a new Purchase order. So then, the company will be ill-prepared for this purchase and may lack funds to pay for it. And this will create a crisis for the business. So due to this, there is a need to automate the core business activities.
No Tracking of POs is possible

If SMEs make their POs on Excel and paper, effortless Tracking becomes a big problem. As there is no mechanism to track the different POs with different PO numbers on Excel in one place. So SMEs cannot track and analyze the information of how many POs got sent and what products in how much quantity got ordered. And this directly affects the decision-making process of the management authorities of companies.

SMEs face the problem of not getting any updates regarding the delivery date mentioned in the POs when they use Excel for making POs. And this piece of information is helpful for them. Small and Medium-sized businesses from the old times have depended upon the Manual way of providing Purchase Orders to their Suppliers on paper. And in some occasions, there were observations like no written Purchase Order was present just, Verbal Communication over a phone call was enough.

This type of behavior in the organization created confusion for both sides of buyers and suppliers. So after incurring some losses in the business, SMEs tend to understand why making Purchase Order is essential for the proper functioning of their companies. And from then, the use of Purchase Orders is seen a lot in SMEs.

So now, if you have come to this article, you want to know about the problems small businesses face with Purchase Order. And before going to talk about let's understand what exactly a Purchase Order means.

## What is Purchase Order?

Purchase Order (PO) is a commercial document made by a Buyer to present the first official offer to the Seller that they want to place an order with the vendors or suppliers of a product and services.

The PO contains a purchase request and the product-related details such as the types of goods, quantity, price, and other terms & conditions which are essential for the transaction. In the absence of a contract between the Buyer and Supplier, the Purchase Order serves as a valid contract when the Vendor gives a proper acceptance to the Purchase Order.

So after understanding what the PO or Purchase Order means. Let's find out the problems which SMEs face with regards to POs.

## Problems which SMEs face with Purchase Orders?

Generally, SMEs and manufacturing concerns make their purchase orders manually on paper or sometimes use Excel. And this behavior of businesses of not automating themselves becomes the biggest problem for them. So the Problems which SMEs with Purchase Orders when prepared manually are as follows:-

<blog-image alt="Purchase Order in Excel" image="PURCHASE-ORDER-IN-EXCEL-1-1024x1024.jpg"></blog-image>

###### 1\. **No Streamlining of POs is possible** 

The PO's, if made manually on paper or Excel, it becomes a little hectic process to follow the Purchase Flow procedures within the organization. Taking the approvals of the person in charge for authorizing the PO within the company will require an extra effort from the person preparing it as he has to send it for approval through mails. And this is an example of an unnecessary step in the Purchase Flow. 

###### 2\. **Communication Gap problem**

If SMEs make POs manually, they have to send the document to all the parties concerned in the department series of separate emails to inform them about it. And if one department may not get the intimation about it due to some mistake, then the whole business might suffer because of lack of communication among departments. To give a glimpse of what problem SMEs might face, let's take an example of the Finance department when it didn't receive any news about a new Purchase order. So then, the company will be ill-prepared for this purchase and may lack funds to pay for it. And this will create a crisis for the business. So due to this, there is a need to automate the core business activities.

###### 3\. **No Tracking of POs is possible** 

If SMEs make their POs on Excel and paper, effortless Tracking becomes a big problem. As there is no mechanism to track the different POs with different PO numbers on Excel in one place. So SMEs cannot track and analyze the information of how many POs got sent and what products in how much quantity got ordered. And this directly affects the decision-making process of the management authorities of companies.

###### **4\. Reminder problems about Delivery dates**

 SMEs face the problem of not getting any updates regarding the delivery date mentioned in the POs when they use Excel for making POs. And this piece of information is helpful for them. As through it, they can coordinate with the suppliers if they have dispatched the products on time or not. And also, can make preparations for the delivery in their warehouses.

## Way Forward

The problems that SMEs are facing with Purchase orders are pretty much the same for every different type of business. And there is the best solution for it is that the SMEs should digitize themselves. Through [digitalization](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonbloomberg/2018/04/29/digitization-digitalization-and-digital-transformation-confuse-them-at-your-peril/?sh=4230d7ba2f2c), only the whole business process in the company will get automated. And by this, many things inside the business will become fast and simple to operate. And in turn, will make the Decision-making process for the Owners fact-based and efficient.

So to help this process of [digitization](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonbloomberg/2018/04/29/digitization-digitalization-and-digital-transformation-confuse-them-at-your-peril/?sh=4230d7ba2f2c) in the business there are many solutions available in the market. And companies should choose from the great pool of software their best option which will suit them in the best way. For SMEs, there is one solution, [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=Problems+of+SMEs+with+Purchase+Order) which can help them in their process of [digitization](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonbloomberg/2018/04/29/digitization-digitalization-and-digital-transformation-confuse-them-at-your-peril/?sh=4230d7ba2f2c). Maintaining a healthy cash-flow is extremely important to run a business smoothly and efficiently. In such uncertain times of growing pandemic situation, we need to focus more on improving the cash-flow in SMEs. In this article, I would try to describe
7 effective ways to maintain and enhance great cash-flow.

When you take on rent for your business use, then you pay small amounts on a monthly basis. This helps to keep the debt to profit ratio in a healthy state. If you buy anything, then certainly you would have to initially invest a lot of amount into it, then your debt may rise if you don’t earn significant profit in the upcoming business cycles. So, in taking up rent, its significantly less riskier than buying anything. Apart from this, when you buy something, may be you would end up paying
on the other hand, while you are using something on rent, you will be exempted from paying taxes, because lease payments are a business expense, and thereby can be written off on your taxes.
Offer discounts for those who pay early to you

This is a very effective way to maintain good cash flow in SMEs. If the customer gets attracted to better offers while he clears his dues earlier than expected, then it’s a win -win situation. Both the parties are at gain.
Conduct a credit check for customers whose payment mode is not cash
So this is very much important for those customers, who takes credit from you. You need to check their
before lending them the product. If the
is not up-to the mark, then be sire, there is a high chance that he won’t be paying you up within the permissible deadline.
Try to create a buyer’s association for your SME to get discounted price

So, almost all the suppliers will offer a discounted price, if you order your supplies in bulk. Then, you need to find more guys, who are ready to purchase the same category products like you, so that, you can place bulk orders each time with the suppliers. You can share the discounted price with your peer buyers group. This helps you to pay the suppliers less, and hence in-turn raises your revenue of the company. So cash-flow for SME is impacted positively.

This is very much necessary to have a healthy cashflow in SMEs. You need to get rid of the products which are no more in demand, and get rid of all such suppliers. No point in getting those things supplied to your warehouse where you won’t be able to clear off the stock to the buyers. In this particular scenario, we have to think rationally and not emotionally. Unnecessarily putting a lot of money to the things less in demand, will raise your debts and impact the cash flow in an adverse manner.
Lessons from COVID-19: 4 inventory management strategies
Have a provision of late payment fees from clients who regularly default the payments

So, out of 10 clients let’s say, there would be 1 or 2 people, who would regularly default the payments and they are reluctant to change this habit. In such situation, the best way to save the cashflow is to introduce a late payment system. It can ensure that there would be a disciplined way of transaction between the supplier and the buyer. This would help in dealing with the cashflow crisis of SME, if arises.
Use electronic payment systems for better cashflow management

Last but not the least, this point can effectively impact your cashflow with the clients. Using electronic mode of payment can help in a lot of ways, including better time management, better efficiency and better handling of money. Also, we can say that, using electronic media, will reduce the hectic process of handling accounts into a process that could be handled by anyone, anywhere. , which has helped over 5000 SMEs to manage a healthy cashflow.

Also, you can negotiate with the suppliers to gain a reduced price, and get discounts, the same thing which you would offer your clients when they tend to pay you early. On a final note, I would like to suggest that review and update your business plans on a regular basis so as to ensure that the trends are checked before the profits and cashflow are impacted negatively.With this, signing off, stay tuned for more such articles.

_data.text:
### Impact on cashflow of SMEs during pandemic and ways to overcome.

<blog-image alt="Ways To Improve Cashflow In SMEs During Pandemic" image="images.jpg"></blog-image>

> _Never_ _take your eyes off the cashflow, because it is the lifeblood of business._

Maintaining a healthy cash-flow is extremely important to run a business smoothly and efficiently. In such uncertain times of growing pandemic situation, we need to focus more on improving the cash-flow in SMEs. In this article, I would try to describe **7 effective ways to maintain and enhance great cash-flow.**

### 1\. **Take rent, instead of buying** for your SME.

When you take on rent for your business use, then you pay small amounts on a monthly basis. This helps to keep the debt to profit ratio in a healthy state. If you buy anything, then certainly you would have to initially invest a lot of amount into it, then your debt may rise if you don’t earn significant profit in the upcoming business cycles. So, in taking up rent, its significantly less riskier than buying anything. Apart from this, when you buy something, may be you would end up paying [property tax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Property_tax) or [wealth tax,](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wealth_tax) on the other hand, while you are using something on rent, you will be exempted from paying taxes, because lease payments are a business expense, and thereby can be written off on your taxes.

### 2\. **Offer discounts for those who pay early to you**

This is a very effective way to maintain good cash flow in SMEs. If the customer gets attracted to better offers while he clears his dues earlier than expected, then it’s a win -win situation. Both the parties are at gain.

### 3\. **Conduct a credit check for customers whose payment mode is not cash**\-

So this is very much important for those customers, who takes credit from you. You need to check their [credit score](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Credit_score) before lending them the product. If the [credit score](https://www.bankbazaar.com/credit-score.html) is not up-to the mark, then be sire, there is a high chance that he won’t be paying you up within the permissible deadline.

### 4\. **Try to create a buyer’s association for your SME to get discounted price**\-

So, almost all the suppliers will offer a discounted price, if you order your supplies in bulk. Then, you need to find more guys, who are ready to purchase the same category products like you, so that, you can place bulk orders each time with the suppliers. You can share the discounted price with your peer buyers group. This helps you to pay the suppliers less, and hence in-turn raises your revenue of the company. So cash-flow for SME is impacted positively.

### 4\. **Improve your inventory**\-

This is very much necessary to have a healthy cashflow in SMEs. You need to get rid of the products which are no more in demand, and get rid of all such suppliers. No point in getting those things supplied to your warehouse where you won’t be able to clear off the stock to the buyers. In this particular scenario, we have to think rationally and not emotionally. Unnecessarily putting a lot of money to the things less in demand, will raise your debts and impact the cash flow in an adverse manner.

Read More - [Lessons from COVID-19: 4 inventory management strategies](/blogs/lessons-from-covid-19-4-inventory-management-strategies/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Ways%20To%20Improve%20Cashflow%20In%20SMEs%20During%20Pandemic)

### 5\. **Have a provision of late payment fees from clients who regularly default the payments**\-

So, out of 10 clients let’s say, there would be 1 or 2 people, who would regularly default the payments and they are reluctant to change this habit. In such situation, the best way to save the cashflow is to introduce a late payment system. It can ensure that there would be a disciplined way of transaction between the supplier and the buyer. This would help in dealing with the cashflow crisis of SME, if arises.

### 6\. **Use electronic payment systems for better cashflow management** - 

Last but not the least, this point can effectively impact your cashflow with the clients. Using electronic mode of payment can help in a lot of ways, including better time management, better efficiency and better handling of money. Ever since the technology has evolved, the cashflow management process an SME has become very easy and smooth. Also, we can say that, using electronic media, will reduce the hectic process of handling accounts into a process that could be handled by anyone, anywhere. There are a lot of start ups right now in India, who are helping the small and medium scale businesses to get digitize themselves for the holistic betterment of everyone, the buyer, the supplier and the clients. One such example is [TranZact](/?utm_source=website&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=cashflow), which has helped over 5000 SMEs to manage a healthy cashflow.

Read More - [Cashless economy: How is it important for India](/blogs/cashless-economy-how-is-it-important-for-india/?utm_source=website%20internal&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=Ways%20To%20Improve%20Cashflow%20In%20SMEs%20During%20Pandemic)

Apart from this, there are a lot of other ways, which we can implement just to ensure a better cashflow management. For instance, you can use, current account with high interest rates, to increase the cashflow. Check with the current rates of interest in various banks, to choose the best among them. Also, you can negotiate with the suppliers to gain a reduced price, and get discounts, the same thing which you would offer your clients when they tend to pay you early. On a final note, I would like to suggest that review and update your business plans on a regular basis so as to ensure that the trends are checked before the profits and cashflow are impacted negatively.With this, signing off, stay tuned for more such articles.

toc.text: What are the different steps in the Approval Process?

children.value: In every small business, life cycle there comes a stage when the organization starts growing. Then the people managing the operations also increase at every step. And that is the point when a need for approval becomes a mandatory requirement for running the business. Because of the companies, increase in size, the development of a hierarchical structure begins, and accordingly, the delegation of authority and responsibility happens. Due to these things, the power to approve a particular process lands on a specific person in the firm. And sometimes, due to a large number of approvers at every step, the process of accepting these requests becomes chaotic. That is when and why the businesses need a proper Approval Management system to automate this whole process.

Nowadays, many businesses are working on half of their capacity due to this ongoing pandemic. Since many officials are working from home, then the manual process of approval management is becoming obsolete. A lot of time goes to waste for sending e-mails and getting these approvals from higher authorities. And to stop all these things from happening, the companies should start using Approval Management software.
So let's start understanding all things relating to the Approval and

Approval management is a business process that involves the management of steps through which an official approval for work from different levels of the organization gets obtained. And the word work here means invoices, purchase orders, customer credit limits, and many other documents and initiatives.

What are the different steps in the Approval Process?

So from the beginning paragraphs, you all may be wondering that what type of steps are there in the approval process. Here is a standard procedure that all companies follow in their approval workflow process.
First of all, the purpose of using this process is to make things easy and fast. And that is why it is a topmost priority to determine the specific time for giving approval or rejection.
The different sub-departments or officials submit a document that needs approval from the authorities at this stage. And the documents can be of any type like invoices, purchase orders, etc.

After the submission of documents to the person in charge, the proper scrutinizing of the papers happen. Then after complete satisfaction, approval is given by the official as if anything goes haywire, it's his responsibility.

As this process is of great importance, security is needed. So because of this, the permission levels are necessary to set. As to who can view this whole workflow, How much access should be given to someone, and who all can edit, approve or reject at every stage.

The second purpose of having this process is to determine the responsibility of a person in charge of all these processes. And to track this, it is a requirement to have a record of those giving the approvals.

Approval Management

Nowadays, many businesses are working on half of their capacity due to this ongoing pandemic. Since many officials are working from home, then the manual process of approval management is becoming obsolete. A lot of time goes to waste for sending e-mails and getting these approvals from higher authorities. And to stop all these things from happening, the companies should start using Approval Management software.

So let's start understanding all things relating to the Approval and [Request Management](https://wiki.optimy.com/request-management/) process.

## What is Approval Management?

Approval management is a business process that involves the management of steps through which an official approval for work from different levels of the organization gets obtained. And the word work here means invoices, purchase orders, customer credit limits, and many other documents and initiatives.

So from the beginning paragraphs, you all may be wondering that what type of steps are there in the approval process. Here is a standard procedure that all companies follow in their approval workflow process.

First of all, the purpose of using this process is to make things easy and fast. And that is why it is a topmost priority to determine the specific time for giving approval or rejection.

#### Documents Submission

The different sub-departments or officials submit a document that needs approval from the authorities at this stage. And the documents can be of any type like invoices, purchase orders, etc.

#### Approver's Approvals 

After the submission of documents to the person in charge, the proper scrutinizing of the papers happen. Then after complete satisfaction, approval is given by the official as if anything goes haywire, it's his responsibility.

#### Access or Permission Levels

As this process is of great importance, security is needed. So because of this, the permission levels are necessary to set. As to who can view this whole workflow, How much access should be given to someone, and who all can edit, approve or reject at every stage.

#### Approval History Logs

The second purpose of having this process is to determine the responsibility of a person in charge of all these processes. And to track this, it is a requirement to have a record of those giving the approvals.

## Way Forward

So to automate the approval management process and to implement the proper workflow, the businesses need to use software solutions. And to help them in this area there is much software available in the market.

Now for selecting the software for themselves, businesses and the persons in charge of managing it must consider all their requirements. Because they should choose software based on the needs, nature, and size of their operations.

_data.description: Do you want to know about Bill of Materials, want to know about BOM types and learn how to implement it in your firm, then Read more about it.
_data.title: What is Bill of Materials - Everything you should know about BOM

toc.text: Why is a Bill of Material (BOM) needed?
How to make a Bill of Material?

children.value: Production or Manufacturing whenever you all hear these kinds of words, the first thing which comes to your mind will be factories and machines. And much other stuff related to the product creation process. But do you have noticed about what is the first step taken into the production planning process? It's the creation of the Bill of Materials (BOM) document. Without BOM, you cannot estimate anything about production like raw materials quantity, other resources requirement, cost of production, profit estimation, etc.
Now to clear the doubts of my readers about this blog. It will answer all your questions about the Bill of Materials (BOM), its usage, meaning, the different types, and many other exciting things.

Before going to a standard definition, let's understand the BOM with an example. Suppose you want to make a particular favorite food item say a Pizza. Then to make that Pizza, you will need a list of ingredients for collecting them before going for cooking. And after you got all your ingredients, you will need an instruction manual to guide you with the cooking process. So, after all of that, your final product will get ready.

The Bill of Materials (BOM) is an exhaustive list document that tells about all the raw materials, sub-assemblies, intermediate assemblies, and information required to manufacture a finished product. The BOM provides all the relevant information like the quantity, quality, shape, size, and others for the production process. The bill of material serves as a communication medium between multiple manufacturing partners and a single manufacturing plant.
Why is a Bill of Material (BOM) needed?

It is the same question as to why we need a cooking guide for making our favorite Pizza? You may not be knowing the ingredients, methodology as to how to cook it, and that is the reason for using the cooking guidebook.

So same reason goes with BOM people who are actually working in the production process may not have a complete idea about the whole process. And if they, by their own judgment, change any component in the manufacturing process, it may go haywire.

Also, the top management cannot easily understand the manufacturing process requirements because they are not working on it directly, and they will need a standard document to understand it. So these are some common reasons where the BOM's presence is necessary. Now let's look into some detailed reasons where BOM helps a business out.

BOM makes clear what all raw materials, resources, and steps, requirements are present in the organization. And accordingly, the quantity requirement is also there. On the basis of these pieces of information, the raw material procurement process becomes easy.

With the help of BOM total quantity and proportion of raw materials required for a particular product gets known. And that is how if we want to calculate the cost of production, it can get done. Further, the management can make decisions based on this cost estimates data and plan the future working model.

BOM gives organizations ideas about raw material and other resources consumption. And that's how they project their short and long-term manufacturing plans. Accordingly, using up their working capitals and controlling their inventory needs. Further, they can quickly determine if there is any problem with the inventory consumptions due to discrepancies.
Inventory Control: Six Best Techniques To Follow

_data.text:
Production or Manufacturing whenever you all hear these kinds of words, the first thing which comes to your mind will be factories and machines. And much other stuff related to the product creation process. But do you have noticed about what is the first step taken into the production planning process? It's the creation of the Bill of Materials (BOM) document. Without BOM, you cannot estimate anything about production like raw materials quantity, other resources requirement, cost of production, profit estimation, etc.

Now to clear the doubts of my readers about this blog. It will answer all your questions about the Bill of Materials (BOM), its usage, meaning, the different types, and many other exciting things.

## What is Bill of Materials (BOM)?

Before going to a standard definition, let's understand the BOM with an example. Suppose you want to make a particular favorite food item say a Pizza. Then to make that Pizza, you will need a list of ingredients for collecting them before going for cooking. And after you got all your ingredients, you will need an instruction manual to guide you with the cooking process. So, after all of that, your final product will get ready.

The Bill of Materials (BOM) is an exhaustive list document that tells about all the raw materials, sub-assemblies, intermediate assemblies, and information required to manufacture a finished product. The BOM provides all the relevant information like the quantity, quality, shape, size, and others for the production process. The bill of material serves as a communication medium between multiple manufacturing partners and a single manufacturing plant.

## Why is a Bill of Material (BOM) needed?

It is the same question as to why we need a cooking guide for making our favorite Pizza? You may not be knowing the ingredients, methodology as to how to cook it, and that is the reason for using the cooking guidebook.

So same reason goes with BOM people who are actually working in the production process may not have a complete idea about the whole process. And if they, by their own judgment, change any component in the manufacturing process, it may go haywire.

Also, the top management cannot easily understand the manufacturing process requirements because they are not working on it directly, and they will need a standard document to understand it. So these are some common reasons where the BOM's presence is necessary. Now let's look into some detailed reasons where BOM helps a business out.

[<blog-image alt="" image="1.png"></blog-image>](?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM)

[<blog-image alt="" image="2.png"></blog-image>](?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM)

##### Material Purchase Planning

BOM makes clear what all raw materials, resources, and steps, requirements are present in the organization. And accordingly, the quantity requirement is also there. On the basis of these pieces of information, the raw material procurement process becomes easy.

##### Cost Estimation

With the help of BOM total quantity and proportion of raw materials required for a particular product gets known. And that is how if we want to calculate the cost of production, it can get done. Further, the management can make decisions based on this cost estimates data and plan the future working model.

##### Inventory Control

BOM gives organizations ideas about raw material and other resources consumption. And that's how they project their short and long-term manufacturing plans. Accordingly, using up their working capitals and controlling their inventory needs. Further, they can quickly determine if there is any problem with the inventory consumptions due to discrepancies.

Read more about - [Inventory Control: Six Best Techniques To Follow](/blogs/inventory-control-6-best-techniques-to-follow/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM)

##### Material Requirement Planning (MRP) & Tracking

BOM is one of the first steps in the Material Requirement Planning (MRP) process, essential to all manufacturing concerns. The process involves many steps. But BOM helps them ascertaining all the quality standards, proportions, and other specific instructions for creating the final product. And accordingly, companies plan everything out. Further, they can easily track everything like whether raw materials reached the warehouse or not, stock levels are sufficient or not, and if there is some additional need of resources or not. And this all goes on continuously because of the Bill of Materials.

##### Maintaining Cashflow

With the help of BOM and the organization's plans, the requirement of working capital will get anticipated. Accordingly, the company will know how to manage their cash inflows and cash outflows to pay for their inputs needs. Further, they can put aside some additional funds for specific months where the procurement quantity will increase on the basis of BOM's material proportions.

Read more about - [Ways To Improve Cashflow In SMEs During Pandemic](/blogs/ways-to-improve-cashflow-in-smes-during-pandemic/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM)

##### Vendor Selection

Bill of Materials specifies the quality and different other specific information for product preparation. And firms using this erudition select the different suppliers or vendors for their raw material requirements. The importance of vendor selection is essential because, in emergency needs, you can rely upon them. Many factors apart from quality and specification requirements go on for supplier selection and rating process.

Read more about - [What is Supplier Relationship Management & Supplier Rating – 6 Methods for doing Vendor Rating.](/blogs/what-is-supplier-relationship-management-supplier-rating-6-methods-for-doing-vendor-rating/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM)

## Types of Bill of Materials (BOM)

In different industries, if you go deep down, many types of BOMs will be present. But majorly, there are only two kinds of BOMs that are differentiated on the basis of their structure. Let's discuss them further.

###### 1\. ****Single-level BOM (Bill of Materials) -**** 

As the name suggests, is the single-level bill of material that shows the components required to create either one assembly or sub-assembly.

The meaning of assembly is the final products that can be sold and used directly. The sub-assembly is the finished product that can become input for other manufacturing processes.

This BOM is used directly in production lines to ease out the understanding of the whole process.

###### **2\. Multi-level BOM (Bill of Materials)** **\-**

The Multi-level BOM has one more name of Indent BOM. So this particular structure BOM helps in showing the relationship between components, sub-assemblies, and main assembly. This relationship has two other titles of Parent-Child and Top-Down methods.

This BOM is of [hierarchical nature](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directed_acyclic_graph), in which the top-level shows a sub-assembly that is one of the main components of the assembly. And how other sub-assemblies, when put together, creates the final product. 

The Multi-level BOM can have both single and multi-level BOMs of sub-assemblies and their own sub-assemblies. Accordingly, the Multi-level BOM helps to break down the process of building up a final product that will have an ultimate use for consumption of any kind.

## How to make a Bill of Material?

From all the above discussions, you all can understand what BOM is, what it does, and what are its two types. And that's why you are wondering how to implement it in your own organization. So to solve this problem, you can use any automation software to create a BOM.

But before that, you should break down all the components and procedures used to create your main final product. Accordingly, you will get to know about all the components that whether you will procure them from somewhere else or will manufacture them. Further, you will decide about the person who will create it and can add revisions to it. Then you will decide about the structure of BOM if it will be single or multi-level. And after that, you will start listing it with the help of a software solution.

## Way Foward

Now, if you are implementing the usage of BOM in your organization. Then I think you are doing it to maintain clear communication and better understanding between different departments. And also to collect and track data and learnings using which you can make efficient key decisions for your firm.

So these all things can only become useful to you only with a digital solution. Because if you will prepare the BOM manually, then the purpose of it will become faulty, and other things will suffer.

So it is advisable to use automation software for the preparation of BOM and other business activities. And the firm can choose from a variety of software available in the market only on the condition that it suits them and satisfies all their needs. [TranZact](?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM) is one such option available for SMEs and Manufacturing concerns.

[TranZact](?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM) is a digital transformation tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. It helps in digitizing the core business activities, which involves the [preparation of the Multi-Level Bill of Materials](/use-cases/category/multilevel-bill-of-material?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM). It provides [BI Dashboards, which tell about the position of cashflows, total balances of creditors, and other reports.](/use-cases?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog&utm_campaign=What+is+Bill+of+Materials+-+Everything+you+should+know+about+BOM) That further helps the users to make data-driven efficient decisions for their business. So firms should choose this software or any other software only if they provide for their nature and size. Otherwise, go for other solutions available in the market if it suits them.

_data.text:
Businesses these days, whether small or large scale, has many processes running inside them every time. And these processes are essential for their smooth operations. Because these companies have various departments working and they all work in coordination with each other. So, if one of the processes gets not done, it could affect their operating activities. Let's talk about the procurement process as it's one of the core activities. If the **Delivery Note** and **Goods Received Note (GRN)** is not perfect, or the employees are not preparing them. Then the communication will get a severe effect between the departments.

Before going into more detail about the usage of GRN and how it is essential for the procurement process, let's understand what it is.

## What is Goods Received Note (GRN)?

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uWxUPO00L0Q?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" />

The **GRN (or Goods Received Note)** is a **2-way document** that verifies that the supplier has delivered the product to the recipient. And this procurement of goods is taking place because of the buyer's Purchase Order.

Further, this document serves as proof that the supplier has fulfilled his obligation as per the agreement with its customer.

Additionally, the meaning that GRN has for the buyers is that it also acts as a quality checking document that verifies their purchases. It confirms that the procurement is happening for the specific quality of products.

Also, it serves as a communication medium between the various departments regarding the purchases.

## How do the GRNs help the businesses?

The Goods Received Note helps the businesses in managing their crucial processes, and these are some of the ways how it is necessary for them -

#### 1\. **Product Verifying document.**

This GRN document alone helps verify the quantity and quality of goods for which the procurement process is happening in the organization.

As on the gates of the warehouse, when the supplier delivers the goods, there is no staff available who has given the specific order and can check these items.

So, to verify these goods at the warehouse gate point, only the warehouse staff matches the goods with the **[Purchase Orders (PO's)](/blogs/problems-of-smes-with-purchase-order/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs)** and the GRNs.

And if only the products match with the description in these documents. Then only the Goods Receipt Notes get issued to the supplier.

#### 2\. **Minimizing the Fake Invoices payments.**

With the help of **Goods Received Note (GRN)**, the business can stop the Fake invoice Payment.

As through the GRN creation and matching process, the whole Purchase Flow process gets a check.

And the documents like [**Purchase Requisite Note**](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/requisition.asp), **Tax Invoices** get a double-check with the GRNs, which verifies the quantities ordered from the departments.

Through this matching, only the possibility of any fraud regarding the pricing or extra quantities gets eliminated. And reduces the chances of any extra payments.

#### 3\. Auto-Updation of Stock levels and Inventory Management.

The GRN document verifies that a delivery of goods was taking place in the warehouse. Further, this document helps the inventory department in maintaining **[accurate inventory levels.](/blogs/the-importance-of-accurate-inventory-levels/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs)**

And through this process, two tasks of Warehouse Management and Inventory Management for further production and selling process starts.

## Way Forward

So to get all these benefits of the GRN document without consuming a lot of time and effort becomes a tough task to manage by the businesses.

And for this task to become easy for them, they need the help of automation software. The business can choose this software from a big pool present in the market. And they should choose only that software that satisfies all their needs. [TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) is such software.

[TranZact](/?utm_source=Website&utm_medium=Blog+-+What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs&utm_campaign=What+is+Goods+Received+Note+%28GRN%29+-+Ultimate+Guide+for+SMEs) is a zero-effort digital transformation tool and platform for SMEs to digitize business processes right, from customer inquiry to dispatch. This software helps businesses in all their invoicing needs and their document processing and verifying needs.
